column30: If you are Catholic, please know that the Church does not support a ""religious objection"" to COVID vaccination. In fact, the Vatican COVID-19 commission and the Pontifical Academy for Life have called for widespread campaigns to educate people on the ""moral responsibility"" to get vaccinated. Due to the ""close interdependence"" between personal and public health, the commission and the pontifical academy warned that refusing to take the vaccine ""may also constitute a risk to others... For this reason, such refusal could seriously increase the risks for public health,"" especially when some people, like those who are immunosuppressed, can ""only rely on other people's vaccination coverage (and herd immunity) to avoid the risk of infection."" In other words, the Church is calling on the Faithful to get vaccinated and is calling on richer nations to support vaccines for poorer nations so that the greatest number of people around the world can be vaccinated as quickly as possible.

column30: Thousands of workers across the U.S. would rather lose their jobs than be vaccinated For 33 years, Karl Bohnak worked at his dream job delivering weather forecasts on TV for what he considers one of the most challenging but beautiful spots in the United States â€” Michigan's Upper Peninsula. He became so popular that ""That's what Karl says!"" became a slogan at his station in the 1990s and even inspired a song. But Bohnak's time as chief meteorologist for news station TV6 came to an abrupt end last month. He was fired after refusing to comply with the vaccine mandate imposed by his station's corporate owner, Gray Television. ""I just did not want to take the shot,"" says Bohnak, who is 68. ""I felt it was my right as a human being and a citizen of the U.S. to decide what I put in my body."" Faced with losing their jobs, even the most hesitant are getting vaccinated Across the country, employers are firing workers for refusing to comply with vaccine mandates. Some people are opting to quit their jobs rather than take the shot. These workers represent only a tiny fraction of overall employees, not even 1% in some workplaces. But it can add up to thousands of people in many states. Washington state reports that so far, nearly 1,900 state workers, including the head football coach at Washington State University, have quit or been fired for refusing the vaccine. In Michigan, 400 workers at the Henry Ford Health System in Detroit walked away from their jobs. North Carolina-based Novant Health fired about 175 employees. And the list goes on. Their resistance has stirred great condemnation and controversy. Many view unvaccinated workers as a potential risk to the workplace. And overwhelmingly, workers have accepted and even embraced the science showing vaccines protect not only you but those around you. The vast majority of Americans have complied with vaccine mandates. But for the vaccine holdouts, walking away from a job comes at a cost, one that's bigger for some than others. In June, about 150 workers at the Houston Methodist hospital system quit or were fired for refusing to get a vaccine, out of a workforce of 26,000. One of them was registered nurse Jennifer Bridges, who has led the fight against Houston Methodist. The hospital system announced its vaccine requirement on March 31. Bridges quickly became the public face of the movement against vaccine mandates. She had five job offers even before she was formally fired, two of them from hospitals that had not yet mandated the vaccine. She started a new job with a private nursing company on the very day she was fired from Houston Methodist. She now cares for a single patient full-time and doesn't believe she'll face a vaccine mandate. ""There's no Medicaid or Medicare [funding]. It's all private pay, so the government has no control over it,"" she says. In June 2021, about 150 employees of the Houston Methodist hospital system resigned or were fired after refusing a COVID-19 vaccin For other Houston Methodist workers, getting fired has had graver consequences. Becky Melcer worked as a scheduler, setting up diagnostic procedures and surgeries from an office building across the street from the hospital. It was a career she was proud of. She had expected to retire from Houston Methodist in another six years or so. Instead, she was fired in June, two weeks shy of her 15-year mark. She applied for unemployment but was denied, told she was ineligible because she'd been fired for misconduct for not following company policy. She's appealing the decision while trying to find another source of income. ""If I wasn't married, I don't know what I would be doing,"" says Melcer. Getting a religious exemption to a vaccine mandate may not be easy. Here's why. At 59, Melcer has had a tough time finding work. She initially tried applying to other hospitals, but they, too, were going to require the vaccine. Now she's looking at customer service jobs outside of health care, even though they won't pay as much as her old job. She's also getting a start in real estate. Melcer was not originally opposed to the Covid vaccine. She'd actually made an appointment to get her first shot in early January. But twice, that appointment was delayed for reasons beyond her control. Then, she says, God came to her in a dream. ""He kept telling me, 'Don't take it. Don't take it.' And I said, 'Really?' And I kept questioning it, and He kept coming back with, 'Yeah, don't take it,'"" she says. So, despite the strong evidence that the vaccines work, her mind is made up. She says she'll never take the vaccine. Meteorologist Karl Bohnak delivers the forecast for Michigan's Upper Peninsula in December 2014. In Michigan, weatherman Bohnak still has a couple of side gigs doing forecasts for local radio. Mostly, though, he is settling into retirement, a year and a half earlier than he had planned. Before he was fired last month, he had been given the option of resigning. ""They wanted me to go off saying, (truncated)

Sue the F_ing pants off of them â€œTort law allows anyone injured by the intentional bad act of another to sue for personal injury, property damage, or economic loss caused by the wrongful activity. The specific claim that relates to harm caused by deliberate misrepresentations is fraud, and, depending on what misinformation someone ingested, and how they reacted to it, itâ€™s easy to imagine that many viewers would be able to state a good claim. Whatâ€™s needed to prove a case for fraud is clearly established through First, the plaintiff has to prove that the defendant made a misstatement of fact, knowing that it was false or with reckless disregard as to whether it was true or false. (â€œReckless disregardâ€ means that the defendant did no investigation at all, but just put the statements out there.) Examples of such misstatements on Fox are abundant. Here are a few clips (starting about 50 seconds in) where Carlson and Lara Trump, as a guest on Sean Hannityâ€™s show, say that COVID is really about â€œsocial control,â€ and where Carlson calls the COVID response a â€œscandal.â€ Hereâ€™s Carlson questioning whether the vaccine works, since those who are vaccinated are still urged to take precautions: â€œMaybe it doesnâ€™t work, and theyâ€™re simply not telling you that.â€ (This is not how vaccine efficacy works. No immunization is 100 percent effective, so thereâ€™s always a small chance of infection, a smaller chance of illness, and an infinitesimally small chance of death even among the fully vaccinated.) Hereâ€™s Carlson giving airtime to Alex Berenson, â€œThe Pandemicâ€™s Wrongest Man,â€ allowing him to spout more nonsense about the vaccineâ€™s supposed lack of efficacy. Want more? Beyond Carlson, here (starting at about 3:21) are some Fox News personalities misrepresenting the door-to-door effort by the Biden administration to educate people and answer their questions about the vaccine. Itâ€™s the Taliban! Itâ€™s a violation of medical privacy! Itâ€™s to force you to take the vaccine! (No, no, and no. The vaccine educators are from the local community; they donâ€™t even work for the government.) These purveyors of misinformation are either lying, or acting in reckless disregard of truth versus falsity by not doing even the most basic research to check out what theyâ€™re spewing. And itâ€™s also considered a misrepresentation to state a half-truth, leaving out vital information needed to place a statement in context. Thatâ€™s exactly the case with Carlsonâ€™s mock questioning of the vaccineâ€™s efficacy; it paints a willfully incomplete picture.

column1: Anti Vaccine Mandate Group aka Fighters For Democratic Freedom
column30: 2022 and here we are almost 2 years on from the original 'it's just 2 weeks to flatten the curve' and we are still seeing restrictions and mandates and I have to ask why? I have a level of appreciation in the first instance when Covid first came to our shores here in Australia and we didn't really know what we were dealing with, however 2 years on, this overreach and abuse of power has got out of control. Everyday our politicians enjoy the soapbox, fear mongering with numbers rather than percentages, hosing down the camera to those who choose to remain Vax Free, labelling them selfish and attempting to exclude them from society as much as possible in the hopes that they will cave and participate in this global trial vaccine. What is the end goal? Why are they so dogmatic? I feel this is a two part complicated answer. If we still have those who are Vax Free, they become some sort of placebo control group, normally this would be a good thing, this way in clinical trials you can make some sort of quantitative assessment of the efficiency of the â€˜Covid Vaccineâ€™. Without a placebo group to compare against, it is not possible to know if the vaccine has had any effect. So why then, do they want the entire country vaccinated with a trial drug? I would say that has something to do with the lack of effectiveness. If we look at statistics from the WHO given this has been the go to for our Government we can gage some kind of idea how effective vaccines, lockdowns and mandates as a collective whole have been. In 2020 â€“ this is before a vaccine was developed and readily available for use. The WHO reported that globally 79,000,000 people contracted Covid and that 77,300,000 survived â€“ 97.84 % survival rate. In 2021 â€“ vaccines became available in this year and the WHO reported that globally 273,000,000 contracted Covid and that 267,700,000 survived â€“ 98.058% survival rate So in two years, lockdowns, vaccines and mandates have allowed us to gain a whopping 0.218% increase in survival rates if you contract Covid. Iâ€™ll repeat that again, ONLY 0.218% The vaccines havenâ€™t stopped you from contracting Covid, nor have they stopped you from spreading Covid however our Government have continued to double down and press on with the narrative that the evidence is clear that the vaccine works. I hear a lot of people say that - oh well Iâ€™m sure Covid would have been worse for me if I hadnâ€™t of had the vaccine. Firstly, you donâ€™t actually know that unless of course you contracted Covid previous to having the shot however vaccines are meant to stop the disease from making you sick, period. Mild or severe. Nor should anyone who has been vaccinated be dying, but they are. Perhaps our government needs to start pointing out that these people died with Covid, not of Covid, and stop classing them as Covid deaths. Direct from the WHO: â€œOur immune systems are designed to remember. Once exposed to one or more doses of a vaccine, we typically remain protected against a disease for years, decades or even a lifetime. This is what makes vaccines so effective. Rather than treating a disease after it occurs, vaccines prevent us in the first instance from getting sick.â€ So I guess you could say, they havenâ€™t really got this vaccine right and itâ€™s still in CLINICAL TRIALS, hence why the Therapeutic Goods Administration (TGA) have only given these vaccines â€˜Provisional Approvalâ€™ for two years, normally this would only be for 6 months. What is Provisional Approval you ask? Direct from TGA - We can give provisional approval to medicines which provide a promising treatment for a serious or life threatening condition. This makes the medicine available for a limited period while the pharmaceutical company completes final clinical trials. Under the standard pathway, a medicine is not available until after all clinical trials have been completed, so this can make a medicine available up to two years earlier than normal. In order to do this, the sponsor must apply and we must be satisfied that the benefit of earlier access for patients is greater than the risk of not yet having all of the supporting evidence that we usually require. As a condition of provisional approval, the company must agree to continue clinical trials and submit comprehensive evidence for review. If they do not follow this plan or submit this evidence, we can cancel the approval. When the limited provisional approval period is up, we review of all the evidence. If we find that the benefit of the medicine to patients outweighs the risks associated with its use, we give the medicine ongoing, full approval. If after the review, or at any other stage, we find the risks outweigh the benefits, we cancel the approval. If the medicine is cancelled, health professionals will discuss other treatment options with patients taking the medicine. Given the survival rate of Covid pre vaccines at 97.058%, Iâ€™m not too sure how it fell into the parameters of serious or life threatening however (truncated)

column30: Iâ€™m wearing a mask again. For a few months after I was vaccinated, I felt safe. But not now. Not with only 52% of Delawareans fully vaccinated. Not when Iâ€™m in a supermarket and see only a few people wearing masks, even though anyone not immunized should be wearing one. Not with COVID-19 cases predicted by some to quadruple in the U.S. Not when 80% of the unvaccinated say they probably or definitely wonâ€™t get the shot. Some countries are taking action. On July 12, French President Emmanuel Macron announced that as of Aug. 1, people must show vaccination certificates before entering trains, planes, restaurants and other public places. There were protests against Macronâ€™s order, but 3.7 million people scheduled to get the vaccine in the first week after his announcement. On July 19, France set a daily record of 900,000 vaccinations. In 1905 and again in 1922, the U.S. Supreme Court upheld the authority of state and municipal governments to enforce compulsory vaccination laws. I have little hope that states will use this authority in time to stop the current COVID-19 surge. Today, it is up to institutions, business owners and individuals to act. The University of Delaware and Delaware State University are among the 600 colleges and universities that require students, faculty and staff to be vaccinated before returning to campus in the fall. Delaware Technical Community College is not on this list. When Bruce Springsteen opened on Broadway last month, everyone in his audience older than 16 had to show proof of coronavirus vaccination. Attendees under 16 had to show a recent negative test. Other entertainment venues have followed suit. A growing number of restaurants around the country are adopting â€œno vax, no serviceâ€ policies to protect their staff and patrons. Iâ€™m retired, so I have the privilege of choosing to stay home and be relatively safe. But thatâ€™s not the case for front-line workers. They must earn a living and thus risk exposure to COVID-19. And that exposure is growing every day. As Dr. Anthony Fauci recently said, weâ€™re â€œgoing in the wrong direction.â€ Letâ€™s do what we can to change directions. Urge theaters, restaurants and places of worship to adopt a policy that requires vaccinations or negative tests. Check to see if plumbers and electricians are vaccinated before they enter our homes. Since the honor system isnâ€™t working, urge all businesses to require everyone to wear a mask. We can begin today by wearing a mask when we go into a store â€” even if we are vaccinated. I have no illusions of changing anyoneâ€™s mind who doesnâ€™t believe COVID-19 is a deadly and highly infectious virus. But I hope those of us who believe the science that the vaccines work will act to protect our front-line workers and avoid another winter of isolation.

'I've lost my joy': Anti-vax Republican, who worked for the Trump campaign and embraced QAnon, says she has COVID-19. A Delaware Republican who said coronavirus vaccines were part of a satanic plan to cause ""mass death"" is recovering from COVID-19, she announced Thursday, saying the illness had caused her to lose ""all of my senses."" Lauren Witzke, a self-styled ""Christian nationalist"" who embraced QAnon and support from white supremacists, was the Delaware GOP's candidate for Senate in 2020, receiving 186,000 votes in her failed run against Democratic incumbent Sen. Chris Coons. In a post on Gab, a social network popular with right-wing extremists, Witzke claimed she was ""recovering from this insane bio-weapon called Covid."" The 33-year-old, who has worked as a political commentator for the right-wing Christian conspiracy site TruNews, said she had decided not to tell anyone earlier so as not to alert ""the shitlibs in the media.""""This bio-weapon is demonic,"" she wrote. ""I've lost all of my senses and struggle with constant indifference, brain fog, and I've lost my joy.""In posts shared on her Telegram channel, Witzke blamed TruNews for making her aware of the infection, insisting that nasal swabs were ultimately responsible for her getting COVID-19. ""I'm an idiot for submitting to their demands and getting tested,"" she wrote, ""and yes I know I need a good husband in my life to keep me from making bad decisions.""She left the company in September. Prior to her departure, Witzke attributed a June outbreak of COVID-19 among TruNews staff to a ""demonic attack"" for having hosted far-right provocateur Milo Yiannopoulos, a former Breitbart writer who now claims to be ""ex-gay."" ""I don't think it's any coincidence that the TruNews crew all got deathly ill, got very sick, right after they brought Milo on,"" she said, as reported by PinkNews.Witzke currently works with Stew Peters, an online broadcaster who has repeatedly pushed false claims about vaccines. On his program, Witzke herself claimed that COVID-19 vaccinations were a ""mass death scale injection"" that would precede the end of the world.Witzke's Senate run was likewise characterized by an open flirtation with extremists, the candidate, for example, tweeting thanks to white nationalist Nick Fuentes for supporting her campaign, The Daily Beast reported. She also shared racist attacks on Democratic Reps. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez and Ilhan Omar.In October, a supporter of Witzke's campaign was convicted of two felonies for pointing a gun at people who were protesting her campaign. The conviction, she maintained, was the product of an ""anti-white, and anti-conservative system"" that is ""coming for us all.""Before running for office, Witzke worked on the Iowa campaign of former President Donald Trump.

column30: ""A boycott of Chapman's Ice Cream totally backfired on anti-vaxxers and the company is now feeling the love from all across Canada. In November, Chapman's, an Ontario ice cream company based in Markdale, announced they'd be giving a $1 raise to all employees who were fully vaccinated and asked all unvaccinated employees to take a rapid test, on the company dime. The $1 raise was meant to balance out the costs of doing the rapid tests. In response, a small group of people decided to start a boycott. The company was flooded with hateful emails, phone calls and even regular mail. But then a counter-movement started with people buying Chapman's Ice Cream just to anger those who started the boycott. And people have been buying freezers full of ice cream, Ashley Chapman, vice-president of Chapman's Ice Cream tells blogTO. ""We've been getting pictures from people who are going out and they're clearing out the freezers at their local stores, and they're taking pictures and sending it to us,"" Chapman says. One group of older ladies got together and decided to buy all the ice cream in their local supermarket. ""They all got together and headed up to the store and cleaned out the entire section in their Loblaws,"" he says. Typically November can be a slow month for ice cream sales but this month sales are up. There were promotions this time last year but not this year and the company was expecting a dip in sales. ""We figured that this November, we would be down and we were up a little bit,"" he says.""

Moron and POS Sen. Rand Paul said Republicans would subpoena Fauci if they win the Senate in the mid-terms. Paul and Fauci have engaged in bitter exchanges at Senate hearings. Paul has pushed unsubstantiated claims that funds approved by Fauci may have helped create COVID. Sen. Rand Paul said that Republicans will subpoena chief White House medical advisor Dr Anthony Fauci if they take control of the Senate in the mid-term elections. The Kentucky Republican is a member of the Senate Health, Education, Labor & Pensions Committee. He stands to be nominated as chairman of the panel if Republicans win the Senate in November, securing him the power to launch investigations and issue subpoenas. ""If we win in November, if I'm chairman of a committee, if I have subpoena power, we'll go after every one of [Fauci's] records,"" Paul said during an interview with anti-vax podcaster Lisa Boothe. ""We'll have an investigator go through this piece by piece because we don't need this to happen again."" Paul, a physician, and Fauci have clashed in a series of heated exchanges in Senate hearings. Paul, often trafficking in conspiracy theories and disinformation, has criticised Fauci on measures he has advocated to contain the virus. His attacks have focussed on Fauci's tenure as head of the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID), and often rely on speculation that funding Fauci approved to a lab in [Wuhan, China, may have been used to create the coronavirus](https://www.businessinsider.com/fauci-gain-of-function-research-wuhan-institute-rand-paul-2021-10?IR=T&r=US&utm_medium=referral&utm_source=yahoo.com). Fauci has denied that [the funding was for so-called ""gain of function"" research,](https://www.businessinsider.com/fauci-gain-of-function-research-wuhan-institute-rand-paul-2021-10?IR=T&r=US&utm_medium=referral&utm_source=yahoo.com) or research into making diseases more contagious. The origin of the virus has not been established, [with China blocking attempts to investigate the source](https://www.businessinsider.com/china-uk-spies-say-theory-covid-19-leaked-from-wuhan-lab-is-plausible-2021-5?IR=T&r=US&utm_medium=referral&utm_source=yahoo.com) of the pandemic. Many experts believe that the theory it originated in a lab is spurious and it most likely originated in nature, though others say it is plausible. In a particularly embittered exchange in January, [Fauci said that Paul's baseless attacks ""kindle the crazies""](https://www.businessinsider.com/china-uk-spies-say-theory-covid-19-leaked-from-wuhan-lab-is-plausible-2021-5?IR=T&r=US&utm_medium=referral&utm_source=yahoo.com) who threaten and harass him and his family. He said Paul was seeking to exploit the pandemic for political gain. At hearing last July, Fauci said ""you do not know what you're talking about"" to Paul, and accused him of ""lying"", after the senator tried to draw connections between research in China partly funded by NIAID and the coronavirus. Paul had at a hearing earlier in the year accused Fauci of indulging in ""theater"" by wearing a mask after having gotten vaccinated, and Fauci responded that vaccines don't offer protection against all variants. Fauci has become a hate figure for some on the right, with many Republicans rallying around opposition to federal government measures to control the virus. Some Republican supporters have embraced fringe anti-vaccine views and conspiracy theories about the virus. Read the original article on [Business Insider](https://www.businessinsider.com/rand-paul-gop-investigate-fauci-wins-senate-2022-2)

column30: I wanted to share some info. Due to many reasons I've been on unemployment benefits for some time now. I had an appointment with my job network provider the other day. She asked about my vax status. I said I'm not. She than asks me if I plan to. I told her this has nothing to do with why I'm here and I'd rather not talk about it. She looks at me with a very obvious disapproving look and goes on to say well if you don't get it. We can't help you get a job. Why are you so against it? I again say to her, I don't want to discuss this. I'm allowed my own opinion and I'm allowed to keep that too myself. Can you please do the same?.. She said ok, we are not supposed to give our opinion so I will stop .. Then when I was leaving she yells out to me, we will check in about your status In two weeks Darren. Have a great day. So in summary. I wasn't told directly I must be vaxed to keep recieving but a guess would be this is what she threatening me with. I think we all figured this would be bound to happen. The gov isn't likely to pay money to you unless you conform. Its just more proof to me this is all about control and it saddens me more and more with each interaction I have like this

We should demand that a real lockdown be put in place until 0 cases and 0 transmission, not vague numbers about vaccination numbers. I really encourage everyone to come along to this online forum on Friday to discuss this pressing issue.
column34: Covid Crisis in NSW: a Profit-Driven Disaster
column35:
Online public forum

The NSW and Federal Governments have utterly failed to manage the Covid pandemic.
Their profit-driven agenda has repeatedly placed the interests of their business backers over the health of the population, and especially the working class population who bear the brunt of any outbreak.
They failed to build proper quarantine facilities, failed to vaccinate the population, and failed to lock down soon enough to stop the Sydney outbreak. Even now, as case numbers continue to rise, the NSW Govt is opening up construction and schools, and thousands of non-essential businesses remain open, putting workers and their families lives in danger.

Their failed policies now pose a huge risk that the Coronavirus, which has killed around 5 million people globally, could be allowed to let rip across Australia.

Meanwhile thousands of anti-lockdown, anti-vax nutcases march in right wing rallies, inspired by the warped worldview of the far right.

The whole pandemic has shown the failings of capitalism. This public forum will discuss these broader issues, and what the left should demand right now to stop the spread and put lives before profits.

Hosted by Socialist Alternative Sydney

column34: The Bulletin
column35:
THE VIRUS WE CALL THE LNP

Australia has a virus epidemic that is one thousand times worse than Corona virus. This virus is going to affect this once great country for at least a decade. The virus is the Liberal National party. 

A broad overview of a planned Job Maker scheme will be unveiled against a backdrop of grim economic predictions including a record deficit, debt exceeding 30 per cent of GDP, unemployment ""around 10 per cent"", and a fall in foreign investment by up to 40 per cent.
This Government Is The Most Corrupt In Australian History.

The Queenslander James Calligeros 
Spurred on by two decades of Telstra owning a private monopoly on last-mile telecommunications infrastructure, the Labor Party envisioned the NBN as the solution to Australiaâ€™s growing digital divide. In 2013, the solution became part of the problem with the Liberal Partyâ€™s total destruction of the program. Why?

No two entities stood to lose more from the NBN than Rupert Murdochâ€™s News Corporation and Telstra. One controlled â€“ and still controls â€“ virtually all regularly circulated print media in Australia. The other controlled a vertically integrated telecommunications monopoly for well over a decade. Together they controlled the only pay TV network in the country â€“ Foxtel.

The NBN posed an existential threat to this triad. It would take away Telstraâ€™s vertically integrated monopoly on telecommunications. Access to streaming services would severely disrupt Foxtelâ€™s monopoly on â€œpremiumâ€ entertainment. Ubiquitous access to real news would deprive News Corporation of its ability to control the countryâ€™s political narrative. For Telstra, News Corp and Foxtel to remain viable, Rupert Murdoch would have to destroy the NBN.

To this end, he relied on an ally in government. A man with no mind, with no ideas of his own. One might almost say a man with no brain. No, not Baldrick, Tony Abbott. The plan was to destroy the NBN from within, and hopefully make a few bucks while doing so.

The 2013 Liberal broadband policy launch was a farce. Abbottâ€™s script was blatantly prepared directly by his puppet masters, as it amounted to little more than a regurgitation of the same hogwash that had been appearing in the pages of Murdochâ€™s The Australian. He repeated lie after lie after lie. 

Laborâ€™s plan is going to cost $90bn (the FTTP cost per premises almost halved from 2011 to 2013). Laborâ€™s plan was not going to be finished until 2030 (FTTP rollout time for a given service area was shortened by weeks between 2011 and 2013). Laborâ€™s plan was extravagant and unnecessary. 

The Liberal Party was taking with it to the election an alternative NBN (in the same way that anti-vax pages are â€œalternative newsâ€). The Liberal party proposed an alternative they promised would be â€œcheaper, faster, sooner.â€ Spoiler alert â€“ it wasnâ€™t any of those.

Abbott continued to belabour the point that the Internet was nothing more than a â€œâ€¦video entertainment networkâ€¦â€ used by entitled millennials to pirate Game of Thrones, and that no one actually needed what Labor was building.

REAL CARRICK RYAN 
I often refer to this Government as the most corrupt in Australian history. I need to stress; this is not hyperbole, it is fact. As we find ourselves immersed in the Sports Rort Scandal:
THE GUARDIAN 
Let's reflect on just SOME or the other corruption and integrity scandals that have plagued this Government.

This is unquestionably unprecedented in the short history of our democracy.
This is why they are doing everything they can do avoid having an Independent Commission Against Corruption (ICAC). This is why we need one more than ever.

SPY GATE 
Bo 'Nick' Zhao, a Chinese born Australian, allegedly goes to ASIO telling them he's been offered a $1million from the Chinese Government to run as a Liberal Party candidate and then infiltrate the Australian Parliament as a Chinese Spy. He then turns up dead in a Melbourne hotel room in March.

Enter Gladys Liu, the Liberal Candidate with a host of concerning connections to the Chinese Government who earns Liberal pre-selection thanks to miraculously raising a million dollars in donations. Fairfax then discovered a photo of Liu at her home with Nick Zhao in the back ground.
Gladys is now the Liberal Member for Chisolm.

SMH 
Liberal Candidates Gladys Liu and Josh Frydenberg both have Mandarin signs at polling booths in the colours of the Australian Electoral Commission branding telling Chinese citizens how to vote (by putting 1 next to the Liberal Candidate). There is no Liberal Party branding on the sign. Liberal officials admit in court that the signs were designed to convey the appearance of official electoral commission material.

ABC

Thanks to a whole series of companies around the world who moved to create their vaccines within 48 hours from the time the Chinese scientists first released the viruses genetic sequence, followed by months of testing in nations around the world, the vaccines are safe and efficient. It's not a matter of vaccine doses supply. Thanks to President Biden, who moved to acquire hundreds of millions of doses and establish hundreds of mass vaccination sites, there are more than enough doses to cover every American citizen No. The problem is vaccine acceptance. And very specifically, the problem is the refusal of nearly half of Republicans to go out and get vaccinated. Those Republicans have given any number of reasons they don't want a jab. Some of them use old anti-vax themes about mercury ( not there ) or a mythical protein that causes women to become infertile ( multiple women got pregnant and had children while taking part in trials ) or a microchip that allows tech giants to constantly track your location ( it's called a cell phone ). column34: Covid Crisis in NSW: a Profit-Driven Disaster
column35:
Online public forum

The NSW and Federal Governments have utterly failed to manage the Covid pandemic.
Their profit-driven agenda has repeatedly placed the interests of their business backers over the health of the population, and especially the working class population who bear the brunt of any outbreak.
They failed to build proper quarantine facilities, failed to vaccinate the population, and failed to lock down soon enough to stop the Sydney outbreak. Even now, as case numbers continue to rise, the NSW Govt is opening up construction and schools, and thousands of non-essential businesses remain open, putting workers and their families lives in danger.

Their failed policies now pose a huge risk that the Coronavirus, which has killed around 5 million people globally, could be allowed to let rip across Australia.

Meanwhile thousands of anti-lockdown, anti-vax nutcases march in right wing rallies, inspired by the warped worldview of the far right.

The whole pandemic has shown the failings of capitalism. This public forum will discuss these broader issues, and what the left should demand right now to stop the spread and put lives before profits.

""In an act of solidarity between two veteran rock stars with a shared history of espousing progressive causes, [Joni Mitchell](https://www.theguardian.com/music/jonimitchell) has joined Neil Young in removing her music from Spotify in protest at it hosting a popular anti-vax podcast. Mitchell, whose 1971 album Blue is regarded as one of the greatest of all time, is the first high-profile musician to take a stand alongside Young against the streaming behemoth. â€œIrresponsible people are spreading lies that are costing people their lives,â€ she said in a [message posted on her website.](https://jonimitchell.com/news/newsitem.cfm?id=1592) â€œI stand in solidarity with Neil Young and the global scientific and medical communities on this issue.â€ Spotify began [removing Youngâ€™s music](https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2022/jan/26/spotify-neil-young-joe-rogan-covid-misinformation) from its platform after he [issued an ultimatum](https://www.theguardian.com/music/2022/jan/25/neil-young-demands-spotify-remove-his-music-over-joe-rogan-vaccine-misinformation) to the company. Referring to controversial podcasts by the comedian Joe Rogan hosted by Spotify, Young said: â€œThey can have Rogan or Young. Not both.â€ Spotify made a swift choice, triggering a storm over anti-vaccine conspiracy theories, cancel culture and the policing of social media. Many of Youngâ€™s fans and supporters of his stance called for a boycott of the streaming platform, and for other artists to follow his lead. â€œI stand with Neil Youngâ€ and â€œ#CancelSpotifyâ€ became rallying calls on social media. Young accused Spotify of â€œspreading fake information about vaccinesâ€ through the Joe Rogan Experience podcast, which has an estimated audience of 11 million. He said: â€œI want all my music off their platform.â€""

I'm not sure if Covid is being exaggerated or if Jimmy Dore really gives a shit about anything beyond ratings.. but taking precautions to be safe and asking why progressives aren't pushing harder to make needed changes are o.k. I'm so tired of the ""fake virus, fake squad"" posts pushing dumb conspiracies.. Just as tired of hearing that Trump sucks. This page shouldn't be a bitchfest or anti-vax medium used to push conspiracies. Let's exchange real ideas and share valid information. Here's my take: I think that regardless of how deadly Covid may or may not be- It is what it is. Our own government in both parties has crippled our means to survive and won't help us otherwise. How do we go forward? As for me I'd rather not take my chances and be wrong- just as global warming and dumping my trash in the ocean may not be as bad as many claim- I'm still going to try my best to take care of them.. As for ""shitty, fake, sellout AOC"" voting for Pelosi.. Let's walk this through shall we? If not Pelosi, then who? Someone worse most likely. There are about less than 10 progressives among 100's of centrist assholes. Sure, it would have been a symbolic ""fuck you"", but there wasn't going to be anyone else for speaker. We already know how spiteful the establishment is- do you really think there would have been a better outcome? As far as forcing an M4A vote- it would get shot down. And then centrists would use that over and over and over again as ""proof"" that the people don't want it. And some handfuls of boommeriffic Karenesque dolts would buy into it- reinforcing the b.s. echo chamber of the establishment who's brainwashed them and making the next vote, and the next even harder. We need to vote more progressives in first. We do not have a large enough coalition yet. Sorry but that's the truth. I'm in government myself. I'm small potatoes but as a board member on parks and rec in a very small, conservative town I need to be very careful with my ideas, how I present them and who to or they WILL railroad me. I'm in secret talks with other ""downlow progressives"" in my town who get it. We can't install a ""homeless shower"" in our public park because 90% of our government would freak out that we communists are using taxpayer money to fund a homeless sanctuary.. so we sell the idea to the rest of the board as a ""much requested amenity by the boaters who pay for our parking and launch fees, thereby increasing revenue"" etc.. It's bullshit, yeah.. but it's how things work here. Until we help more of us get elected to more posts, our power is limited. Our strength is in our numbers and also our knowledge of the process. Imo, based on my own actual, real world government experience as a 3 year appointed official, it's way way too early to write off any of the few progressive leaders we so desperately need right now. I highly encourage anyone reading this to sit in on some of their city council meetings that are open to the public- and better yet, go for an open seat on a committee.. because many of you literally have absolutely 0 clue how government or the process works. It's not easy. I am 20 to 25% of a vote that deals with things that can cost my small town 6 or more figures. That last vote I had to choose between additional $180k night lighting for a baseball field (where most of our adult council members are huge night baseball fans) or to refurbish the only children's playground in town and the only place for poor families and young kids to hang out. I was the only vote for the playground, the other members voted to add more lights to our already illuminated field. They were not happy with my vote and they still got their stupid, wastefull, unnecessary lights anyway. Because of my votes they may not want me on the committee when my term expires.. I don't know. But the point is you don't either. I'm not yet ready to write AOC off.
Please read this before you decide to share conspiracies about Covid and vaccines

""The far right â€œtrucker convoyâ€ that has paralysed [Ottawa](https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2022/feb/08/ottawa-truckers-protest-anti-vaxx-canada) might be singularly shocking, but what disturbs the most is itâ€™s not unique. â€œFreedomâ€ protests similar in form and simultaneously nebulous in broadly anti-vax/anti-mandate political goals have materialised in [Britain](https://www.scottishdailyexpress.co.uk/news/scottish-news/scottish-freedom-convoy-heading-london-26142526), [France](https://www.telegraph.co.uk/world-news/2022/02/10/france-bans-freedom-convoy-entering-paris-protests-against-covid/) and [New Zealand](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2022/feb/10/new-zealand-police-clash-with-anti-vaccine-protesters-during-eviction-operation). A convoy claiming to originate from across Europe is making its way towards [Brussels](https://twitter.com/BernieSpofforth/status/1490828488680505345?s=20&t=kiHImKrSW95E9VYU6dGCZQ). An ongoing gathering that locals alternately describe as â€œSpring Break for QAnonâ€ or â€œCamp Covidâ€ is encamped outside Australian Parliament House in Canberra. Across these countries, protestors appear as a wild herd of â€œsovcitâ€, anti-vaxxer, QAnonner and more nefarious fellow travellers, alongside some more ordinary people. Sometimes itâ€™s hard to tell whether social media content about these events has been gathered by extremism monitors, or comedians."" ... ""**Wherever this â€œfreedom movementâ€ manifests, a similar cast of characters emerges. Light-in-the-eyes zealots holler conspiracy theories. Grifters solicit to camera like a roll of tabloid clickbait. Burly, closed-mouth types appear to be handling secretive logistics. Around them are impassioned, often inarticulate â€“ and poorly-costumed â€“ clowns.** **Donâ€™t let the ridiculousness distract from the threat.**"" ... ""But the relevant historical lesson is that the threat to democracy doesnâ€™t come from the proportion of the people these groups can claim to represent. Itâ€™s about the size of the damage they are willing to do. Writing off Canberraâ€™s buffoon insurgency just as a loud thing blocking the carpark is a mistake. **What was learned from last yearâ€™s United States Capitol attack of 6 January and Melbourneâ€™s violent anti-lockdown protests was that people donâ€™t have to be able to comprehend the politics of the movement theyâ€™re in to be weaponised by them.** The [swastikas](https://finance.yahoo.com/news/nazi-flags-truckers-protest-152500396.html?guccounter=1&guce_referrer=aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuZ29vZ2xlLmNvbS8&guce_referrer_sig=AQAAANrND16c4c_Du94HBFpyLtIHZZOBFp1mo7M0_5pwp_FZMdRiR9eY3YUo4bX9YPFlGzeU-jxYYDgicD_pVvAWZ-iCd_SciQqt015qr-J2s1vJs6VcR9ma4SivZl1gxrd1eT80y0BjRNmml2KgKZfHGs-pA_CVwR9LqpWUiIfrgn4n), confederate flags and other sly hate symbols that appeared at protests go wilfully unheeded by the wellness-influenced anti-vaxxers and others literally marching beside them. William Saletan recently made the [frightening point](https://www.thebulwark.com/lies-are-the-building-blocks-of-trumpian-authoritarianism/) that those Americans who have become the greatest threat to their republic are those whoâ€™ve been convinced by propaganda lies that theyâ€™re saving it."" ... ""**The street-level participants of these protests donâ€™t have to be slick, admirable or coherent to be useful to this movement â€“ just credulous, unquestioning and willing to be mobilised. **Where the protest presence grows, so do [arson attacks](https://globalnews.ca/news/8600592/trucker-convoy-police-investigating-arson-apartment/) and warnings of escalating violence. The Museum of Australian Democracy was recently [set on fire](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-australia-59824914); **itâ€™s time to face we are in the era of Brownshirts Without Borders. Unless we can formulate international tactics for dealing with them, itâ€™s not just Ottawa thatâ€™s under siege. Itâ€™s democracy in the west.**""

column35:
DATELINE RBNews2021 â€“ August 19 â€“ No On Recall

A small contingent of Napa's Democrats, members of Indivisable Napa,  and other like-minded citizens met today at the corner of Soscol and First Street with signs, American Flags and literature opposing the attempted recall of Gov.  Newsom.

The group was greeted with a chorus of honking horns in support of the rally's message: VOTE NO ON RECALL! with an occasional obscenity hurled through an open window. Why is it that the first response of the opposition, presumably Republican, seems so very often to be nearly inarticulate obscenities?

The likely greatest stimulus for the recall action is a whopping amount of California, and out of state, Republican money latching onto Gov. Newsom's efforts to mitigate the Covid-19 Pandemic as an excuse. Gov. Newsom has followed well-grounded health and safety medical protocols in an extreme pandemic emergency, as has most of the states in the country.

It is well-documented now that the former presidentâ€™s lies (it's a hoax) and misdirection (it'll go away on its own) have been responsible for hundreds of thousands of Covid cases that didn't have to happen and over a half million American death's, two-thirds of which didn't need to happen.

The leading Republican candidate, Larry Elder, in the recall, should Newsom actually lose, is  one of the FORMER president's California supporters whose personal beliefs (one can hardly call them policies) are essentially anti-California and anti-Californians. By supporting that wanna-be king, Larry Elder de facto:

â€¢ Supports that the election was stolen by fraud (it has been proven to be fair and legitimate!)
â€¢ Does not support complete vaccination to protect against Covid-19 
â€¢ Does not support masking to protect friends, neighbors and people encountered ... or themselves (he has indicated he would undo all mandated and proven safety protocols issued to mitigate the pandemic)
â€¢ Does not support a living wage for workers (he is against raising the minimum wage)
â€¢ Does not support common sense gun reform
â€¢ And he is a radio personality who uses his program to support anti-vax conspiracies as being related to some secret governmental population control program ...

â€¢ ... AND THIS JUST IN FROM POLITICO & SFISTdotCOM: 

â€¢ ""Leading the polls among Republican recall candidates, AM radio talk show host Larry Elder faces allegations from his ex involving gun threats, exploitive kinks, and lots of marijuana.""

It seems that Elder's ex-girlfriend Alexandra Datig sent out the following tweet yesterday (Aug. 18):

""I am calling on the voters of California to tell Larry Elder to let me out of my NDA [Non-Disclosure Agreement!] There are no secrets in politics! Voters have a right to know the truth! @LarryElder is unfit to serve in an official capacity! Tell him you want to know why!""

The SFIST dot COM report has its genesis from POLITICO and from Elder's ex-girlfriend, Alexandra Datig.

It all fits into the FORMER president's stable of sycophant minions. Elder's ex-girlfriend was a member of Heidi Fleiss's workers. To her credit, she did help bring Fleiss down. 

Nevertheless, the social environment is one that the FORMER president would certainly have approved. 

And one is pretty certain he would have approved waving a loaded gun around in front of said ex-girlfriend, although likely would have disapproved him being allegedly stoned on pot while he waved  the gun.

And apparently, the NDA has kept Datig from revealed further details of her allegation of abuse and misconduct, and more than anything, has served to add a new category of mud to an already muddied recall effort.

Newsom was elected governor by a landslide majority over the Republican candidate John Cox. The recall is a Republican effort to undo that election. The sad and unfortunate thing is that some other selfish, self-centered citizens have joined the recall because of the pandemic mitigation protocols put in place. When they were lifted a couple of weeks ago, the even more deadly variant, Delta Covid surged and cases began to increase in Napa and in California, as did deaths increase.

Anti-vaxers and anti-maskers are killing people across the nation, and one of these buffoons is leading the charge to be governor in California.

No question on it at all: NO ON RECALL! Keep Gov. Newsom Governor!

column30: This Saturday come along to this important anti-fascist protest to take a stand against the growing far right in Melbourne. They are bringing together hard-right political parties and politicians, neo-nazis, Trump supporters and QAnon conspiracy theorists. It's important for anyone leftwing and progressive to take a stand against these people promoting their anti-human ideas in our streets.
column34: PROTEST: Stop the far right in Melbourne!
column35:
This is organised as a COVID-safe event. All participants are requested to come fully vaccinated and wearing masks.

Join the Campaign Against Racism and Fascism in Melbourne to protest the far-right trying to march in our streets, as part of a national day of anti-fascist action. Let everyone know that Melbourne is an anti-fascist zone! 

On November 20 the far right will be holding another rally. Those organising the protest are linked up with other far-right movements around the world. Their politics are deeply reactionary. They stand against public health measures including the restrictions and vaccines that have saved countless lives. While our hospitals and healthcare workers are being overrun, they celebrate selfish individualism that would see the bodies pile high as the virus rips through the community unabated. 

This far-right worldview is intensely anti-human. It has seen protesters spit on Melbourneâ€™s healthcare workers, shout racist abuse at Aboriginal people who oppose them, and close down a vaccination hub that services the homeless.  

The upcoming protest is organised by Melbourne Freedom Rally, a shadowy outfit led by Harrison McLean.  McLean was recently exposed for plotting to use COVID-19 scepticism to walk people towards far-right fringe conspiracism and the â€œJewish questionâ€. Supporters include Reignite Democracy Australia, the electoralist arm of the movement who have recently teamed up with Clive Palmer and Craig Kelly to create a new far-right force in Australian politics. Proud Boys, a neo-fascist, misogynist and anti-trans all-male group are regular attendees at these protests, seeing them as a fertile breeding ground for their ideas.

These figures are drawing inspiration and encouragement from far-right advances around the world. In October, a like-minded mob of fascists physically attacked and destroyed trade union offices in Rome. In New York, anti-vax protesters tore down a COVID-19 testing tent.  When the far right advances like this, it is an immediate threat to people of colour, women, and LGBTI people, who are set within their crosshairs. This vile scum must be opposed by ordinary people.

Relentless counter-protests were how we defeated the far-right Reclaim Australia movement in 2015. To defeat the fascists this time we must build our forces and politically counter them. CARF is organising a counter-demonstration against the far right on November 20 to show public opposition to these views and organisations. We call on all anti-fascists and all those who support public health to join our rally and build the movement against the far right.

This rally is endorsed by:

Victorian Socialists
Cllr. Jorge Jorquera - Maribyrnong Council
Cllr. Sue Bolton - Moreland Council
Socialist Alternative
Socialist Alliance
The Italian Network of Melbourne
Geelong Anarchist Communists
Workers Art Collective
Health Before Profits

column30: With all due apologies, I acknowledge many members of this group will have been more politically active and experienced than I am. I promise to seldom post, but I have a thought to put before you. I have had interactions with a number of people who seem entitled and privileged but seem to wish to affect otherwise. To explain, these are seeming social justice warriors who are acrimonious and can't seem to form coalitions to achieve meaningful change. To explain, they might march in Black Lives Protest events but seem intent on making their march more about getting attention for themselves. In the specific example I have mind, a so called advocate for LGBT issues was being told to shut up by actual LGBT people because they were being insulted by her presumption and intolerance. I suspect there is a form of SJW who is like a narcissistic human version of the cuckoo bird. (Short version, the bird puts its eggs in the nests of other birds and her chicks push the other eggs out of the best.) So, I am not an African American. I support their cause and needs, but I want to give them support as opposed to inserting myself. My ego doesn't need to be on the screen. However, some white people seem to be attacking a successful female black lawyer who was chosen for VP. This is what inexplicable if they care about the issues in a way that needs concrete change. On any liberal issue. Joe isn't Trump and Kamala isn't Pence. Healthcare, MeToo, BLM, police brutality, affordable college, social security, welfare, and appropriate COVID response. On any liberal issue the choice for President is Joe/Kamala vs Trump/Pence. Any attack on Joe/Kamala should be phrased in such a way to point out that Trump/Pence is a better choice. No false choice. This is the actual choice at this point. On no liberal point I know of is Trump a better choice than Joe. So the ""Warriors"" aren't loyal to any particular cause. Certainly, they are not loyal to the Democratic Party. You might suggest they are loyal to their Prophet, Bernie, but he has said explicitly for his followers to support Joe. There is no, apparent, explanation for their aversion to Joe in the current context. Their actual goals are an indecipherable mystery. They are no more responsive to reason or discussion than an anti-vax or anti-mask conspiracy theorist. Their minds are, so far as I can tell, inscrutable. Quite possibly, they have formed some odd addiction to arguing and being an outsider that being angry and ranting is, actually, their only divisive goal. Some emotional compulsion requires them to dig in come whatever may. And here is the important point (thanks for humoring me) because the actual results don't really matter. They exist in a state of Privilege where if, say, a black man has his neck knelt upon by a cop while saying ""I can't breathe"" as being filmed with several of his buddies standing by doing nothing to preserve the life of an American citizen *it doesn't matter enough to them that this happens to stop arguing and defeat Trump so actual change of any sort can possibly happen to improve the situation.* Essentially, I suspect the very worst racists who are most responsible for systemic racism may actually attend Black Lives Matter marches.

**REPOSTED AS A PUBLIC SERVICE ANNOUNCEMENT (PSA) FOR THE AZ REPUBLICAN PARTY (LD-22)... ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸** **Attention Precinct Committeemen**: I've been contacted by numerous healthcare workers that they are about to lose their jobs over the Nov 1. COVID vaccine mandate. My advice to them includes two paths of action. I am also in contact with several elected and political officials to help bring this issue to a boiling point. Both these paths require unity in message and a very large unified front, so we all need to be working together. The underlying point to reinforce is that these vaccines were rushed through, have not had proper testing, are not approved by the FDA, and were previously rejected for use during a previous SARS outbreak. This sets this particular vaccine apart from other vaccines. We must stress the distinction between this and other anti-vax arguments. This is not an anti-vax objection as I have taken plenty of vaccines and understand their benefits. It's a demand for freedom of choice. **Path 1: Governor**: We are currently still under an emergency order to address the pandemic situation. This order originally was enacted to protect our healthcare capacity to respond to the outbreak. Forcing health workers to choose between an untested, highly politicized vaccine and their employment in the industry puts Arizona's healthcare provision capacity at risk. With greater than 40% of the population (and higher percentages in healthcare) choosing not to take the vaccine at this time, we risk losing up to 40% of the healthcare workforce over this issue. We cannot afford this risk during a pandemic and an uncertain delta variant impact on societal health. We must urge and support Ducey to extend his ban on vaccine mandates to hosptials and healthcare education. Ducey needs to be made aware of the risk to the AZ healthcare system. **Path 2: Unionization**: While a formal unionization is not necessarly needed, we need create the same effect and thus must unify under this common cause to generate the political clout needed to force the issue with elected officials (the Governor's office, then later legislatures), and put serious pressure on corporate interests who are running the big pharma and hospital lobbies that have aligned against the people for sake of profit. At one point in history, unions served a valid and noble purpose but since lost their way. Today we see the opportunity for a revival of the original concept and once again start standing for the people. Even some unions of old are understanding this is wrong: https://abc7ny.com/newyork-presbyterian-hospitals-vaccine-mandate-nyc-covid-update/10903483/ The potential of strike or mass exodus is powerful. Many have said they are writing their legislators and elected officials on the issue but this won't be enough. The Legislature is out of session and in session did not have the votes due to a couple cowardly Republicans and ALL the Democrats to address the issue. Let them know what you believe and that you are taking additional action. Our Congressmen are in the minority and there is not path to take action at that level until regaining the Congress in 2022. Let them know what you believe and that you are taking additional action. The Governor has the ability under emergency powers to stop immediately this mandate. There is a valid and compelling concern of putting AZ's capacity to provide healthcare and respond to changes in the pandemic at risk. Let his office know where you stand, express concern over the risk to AZ's healthcare capacity and that you are taking additional action. **TAKE THE ADDITIONAL ACTION**: Start unifying others and informally or formally unionize. As much writing to elected officials is helpful, you need to do ten times this amount in organizing your peers. A unified front of 40% of the workforce cannot be ignored. I'm also quite sure there are vaccinated peers that feel like you do also so don't assume it's a vaccinated vs. unvaccinated issue. Our elected officials are being pressured by big pharma and hospital lobbies with lots of money. We must unite to combat this with numbers and money of our own. Unity, organizing and courage are the keys to this issue. Best regards, Eric Morgan, Chairman Arizona Republican Party, LD-22 bleedred@planetmorgan.net 602.410.7163

column30: Copied not my words but struck a chord! I consider myself very fortunate to have a lot of friends on Facebook - a mixture of people I grew up with, friends from college, relatives, many people I used to teach, work colleagues, friends of my friends, and more recently a lot of friends who I discovered shared a similar outlook, socially and politically. And when I say friends, I do genuinely mean people I care about in some way - my politics have always been defined by caring about those I don't know, as well as those I do. It is quite heartbreaking at the moment to see so many of these friendships (both with myself and with others) put under strain by dangerously divisive messages coming from the far right in the US. Whatever crises or problems there are in the world, they each need to be considered on their own merit and dealt with through a rational response based upon evidence. We do not live in a binary world where everything falls on one side or other of some great divide - some of the issues are interlinked, and occasionally there is evidence of some kind of conspiracy or cover-up, but it cannot be the default position of any sane or rational person to think that everything is linked and that there is a Grand Conspiracy, with increasingly wild and far-fetched (and always unproven) claims and accusations. What is commonly referred to as the 'rabbit hole' is a collection of struck-off doctors, media personalities, politicians and broadcasters pulling together a myriad of YouTube videos, memes and 'he said, she said' testimonies, each of which can be disproved with 5 minutes of searching on the internet. These 'conspiracy theories' actually damage and weaken the real conspiracies taking place in society, such as the drive to increase wealth inequality that sees rocketing homelessness at the same time as increasing numbers of billionaires, the poisoning of populations through the use of chemicals in our food supply, the abandonment of the environment to market forces, the secret trade deals that weaken our rights as consumers and workers, the illegal wars and genocides that kill our populations as well as the planet. What the right has cleverly done, through groups like QAnon, is weave their easily disprovable 'conspiracy theories' together into a package that makes it easy to entrap people who would not necessarily know what else is being suggested, who then subscribe to dangerous views that run counter to what they might previously have stood for. Good examples of this were the marches that took place last weekend, purportedly about 'saving the children' and 'freedom of speech' - two concepts that would understandably draw in a lot of passing support - that were heavily attended by fascists and the far right, people who would never normally appear at a march to support students, the NHS, XR, or the People's Assembly. Online, people are connected to posts and memes spreading all kinds of disinformation that taps into the understandable fear and mistrust people are feeling about the direction society is travelling in. Particularly heartbreaking for me is to see friends who previously were most concerned about environmental issues, Palestine, racism, homophobia and other real issues, being diverted into something that has the opposite voice. And the nexus of all this is the real battle between good and evil that is taking place in Trump's America right now. And sadly, there are people who should know better who are being drawn into supporting that wannabe dictator because their conspiracy theories have told them that he is on the side of whichever truth they have been lulled into believing. The important things that need to be remembered, and repeated to those who have disappeared down that 'rabbit hole', is that support for Trump and these various conspiracy theories (5G, Pizzagate, Plandemic, Bill Gates, anti-vax, anti-mask etc etc) means that in the binary world they've created, you also support by association all of the following: - homophobia - racism - transphobia - Islamaphobia - mysogyny - disablism - white supremacy - the undermining of democratically elected foreign governments - uncontrolled militarism - genocide of Palestinians and Yemenis - destruction of the Middle East, particularly Syria - the creation of hundreds of thousands of refugees - poverty - homelessness - inequality - anti-environmentalism - anti-science and many, many more reactionary positions. All of these can be proven by a quick internet search of what has been said by Trump and his fellow 'conspiracy theorists' and the actions they have taken. And yet many people caught in this net of conspiracy will have LGBTQ family members, or have friends of different races and religions, and be the people most affected by the real conspiracies of this world. In this febrile and unsettled times, people are understandably groping for certainty - but please spend a moment to look into which side you are really on. There is no (truncated)

column30: This club have REFUSED to take part in a Vax passport trial. Please like their page and congratulate them.
column33: WATER COMEDY HOT CLUB Est. 2010 OFFICIAL STATEMENT
column34: Hot Water Comedy Club
column35:
We agreed to be part of the â€˜Event Research Programmeâ€™ in early March. We were made aware that the purpose of this landmark event was to prove that venues and events like ours could be safely reopened and take place. We understood that evidence of the results would be used to support the case for the FULL reopening of venues like ours WITHOUT the need for social distancing. Vaccine passports were never at any time mentioned in any of the discussions we had prior to agreeing to put on the event.

The Liverpool Echo released the article, noted below, on 13th March after we had agreed to be involved. 

https://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/news/liverpool-news/liverpool-clubbers-party-early-under-20140771

We believed that Culture Secretary Oliver Dowden set out clearly the intention of the event when he said: 

""These test events will be crucial in finding ways to get fans and audiences back in safely without social distancing.

""We will be guided by the science and medical experts, but will work flat out to make that 
happen. We want to get the people back to enjoying what they love and ensure some of our 
most important growth industries get back on their feet.

""These are important steps towards the safe and special summer we all crave and that Iâ€™m 
fully focused on delivering.""

We were closed for most of last year but did open whenever legally allowed. We spent over Â£30k on becoming covid secure based on government guidance and had extra staff on hand to make sure that all customers were checking in on the track and trace app. To this day we have never had a single case linked back to us, but we were still forced to close. We were among the first industries to close and will likely be amongst the last to open.

Fast forward a few weeks to a press release sent out by the government to all UK media. The headlines were all about â€˜vaccine passportsâ€™. For some reason, all trials had been bundled together under the same press release and it seemed that we were part of the vaccine passport programme. We also happened to be the very first event of any trial in operation so, not surprisingly, the headlines mentioned â€˜Hot Water Comedy Clubâ€™ and â€˜The Vaccine Passport Programmeâ€™ as if we were part of the Programme. 

On Saturday evening, around 9:30pm, we were made aware of an article in The Mirror closely followed by one in the Liverpool Echo with headlines about vaccine passports and our involvement with them. We then contacted Liverpool Council along with our contacts at the venue as we were very concerned about the way we had been portrayed in the media linking us to vaccine passport trials, something we had never agreed to. Below is an extract from the email I received Liverpool Council.

   â€œThis story is wide of the mark â€“ I am assured by the DCMS that this has not been briefed     
out by them.

We will be clear in our comms that there will be no use of vaccine passports.â€

Unfortunately damage had already been done. Over the next 2 days we were subject to a hate campaign from people opposing the vaccine passport across our Facebook channel, Twitter, Instagram, emails, text messages, negative reviews, refund requests and phone calls. We have over 4,000 separate examples of negative reaction which have significantly damaged our business and brand.

We went out on all of our social channels and had over 15 interviews with the media to correct the record about our involvement in the trial event and what we had agreed to be a part of. Unfortunately there are lots of articles still circulating wrongly stating our involvement.

Yesterday evening we were made aware of the following document;
(https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/covid-19-response-spring-2021-reviews-terms-of-reference/roadmap-reviews-update). This, in our opinion, is very unclear and confusing as it looks like this trial is a pre cursor to covid status certification (vaccine passports) led events further down the line.

As a consequence of misleading press releases/media articles and the confusing messaging on the official government website (which was last updated on 5th April 2021) we have made the decision not to be a part of any programme at all. We have still not managed to speak to anybody in the government about this.

We look forward to seeing you all again soon!

Hot Water Comedy Club
www.hotwatercomedy.co.uk

column30: A Georgia restaurant will refuse service for unvaccinated people after breakthrough COVID infections among fully vaccinated staff An Atlanta, Georgia restaurant owner decided only to serve fully vaccinated customers.The restaurant announced the rule on Instagram earlier this week, showing a ""No Vax, No Service"" sign that aims to reduce the spread of the virus inside the establishment.Armando Celentano, a co-owner of Argosy Restaurant and Bar told the Atlanta Journal-Constitution the decision came after he and three of his employees tested positive for the virus even though they are all fully vaccinated, marking an instance of breakthrough infections. ""It is a question of quality of life and safety for my staff and guests,"" Celentano told the outlet. ""It's a privately owned, small business and I have to do what I think is right to protect the people who rely on me to make a living."" Approximately 38% of people in Georgia are fully vaccinated, according to data from the New York Times. As the more contagious Delta variant spreads throughout the US, vaccinated people are not 100% immune and could still become infected with COVID-19.""COVID-19 vaccines are effective and are a critical tool to bring the pandemic under control,"" the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention said. ""However, no vaccines are 100% effective at preventing illness in vaccinated people. There will be a small percentage of fully vaccinated people who still get sick, are hospitalized, or die from COVID-19."" The rule sparked mixed emotions from some residents who spoke to Atlanta's WSB-TV. One person told the outlet the mandate is ""a bunch of crap."" Another said it's ""unfortunate"" because they don't want the shot. Despite the pushback, Celentano told the outlet he has no problem asking customers if they are fully vaccinated. "" This is no different than 'no shoes, no shirt, no service,"" he said.Dr. Anthony Fauci said in a White House briefing earlier this month that it was ""reasonable"" to assume fully vaccinated people are less likely to spread COVID-19 infections, even with a ""breakthrough"" case, Insider's Andrea Michaelson previously reported .

column30: I have been on the fence with this vaccination issue and have heard both sides. The issue is the fear of what bad outcome COULD happen as a result vaccinations and the actual reality that of thousands of unvaccinated kids in recent years have had measles and other preventable, communicable diseases to the point where schools have had to close. Everyone our age grew up with vaccinations and few have had problems directly relating to them. Your choice is a rare negative reaction to a vaccine or actually contracting a horrible disease with all that implies. I also notice that the Anti-vax crowd is aligning itself with other paranoid groups such as gun nuts and others who just won't stay inside anymore and believe the whole CV issue has been overblown and is some kind of hoax to control the population. In other words, typical brainwashed trump supporters/sheep. Some worry about the ability of ""the government"" to trace them via their smart phones. Well, duh, don't use a smart phone if you are so scared of that! Give up the GPS in your car and navigate yourself! BTW, trump IS the government now. None of these people have any suggestions let alone solid proven ideas for what can be done to control and eradicate the very serious CV pandemic which would be far worse today if it were not for the stringent precautions. I'm all for natural means of staying generally healthy, but when hundreds of thousands or millions of lives are at stake worldwide, stronger action, formulated by experts in the field of public health, is needed.

column30: I've decided to try to extend my opinion on covid-19 by posting in all of the groups I follow. When tuberculosis (TB) was rampant in the United States of America, people who exhibited any symptoms or tested positive were hospitalized in Tuberculosis Sanitariums. If they refused they were forcibly hospitalized there until they were cured. Until leprosy was understood, people with it (lepers) were shunned and forced out of cities to survive on their own. Covid-19 is still not fully understood, but anybody with an understanding of how medications are approved for use by the medical community in the United States of America knows that their first concern is do no harm. Then they begin the process of approving for trials where the stated purpose for the medications is tested in controlled conditions. The covid-19 vaccine development used mrna research to quickly develop the primary vaccines we use in the United States of America. They had a significant head start on vaccine development. That meant vaccine development didn't start from the very beginning, but focused on utilizing mrna as the delivery system. Trials began much faster than normal because of the head start mrna gave them and because Operation Warp Speed created focus on a vaccine for covid-19 by all pharmaceutical and health research organizations. I have a small pox vaccination scar, but my grandchildren don't. I have had multiple tuberculosis tests, but I don't know that my grandchildren have had any unless required by their environment. My mom took me to get the Salk polio vaccine the first time I could get it. I've had measles, for which I continue to suffer because of the virus it left in my body. My grandchildren have not. Public health is a great thing until it inconveniences us. Peanut products are excluded from many classrooms because a child might have a life-threatening allergic reaction. Public schools require proof of vaccination for several diseases. Covid-19 is just one more thing to make schools safer for students, teachers and all other staff. When I worked in surgery and other health care settings, I was often required to wear a mask. If the doctor required masks I wore one. Otherwise I was expelled from the room because my refusal wasn't in the best health interest of everyone else in the room. If an infection was discovered in the Healthcare facility, every protocol was stepped up by at least a factor of 10. We not only protected the patient and ourselves, but everybody in the building complex. I've written all of this to nudge you to think about others, students, teachers and all staff. Hopefully that will get you to the decisions to do your part to protect the most people. We can get through this just as we in the United States of America have been able to survive previous health scares. Vax up! Mask up! It will get us back to some normalcy until we beat covid-19 and all its variants. Peace
