Canadaâ€™s massively disruptive truck convoy is yet another live product of disinformation invented by Qanon conspiracy leader James Bauder from the group known as Canada Unity. They have the assistance of other Canadian Qanon groups like Action 4 Canada, who have joined forces with them. Disinformation has real consequences for the lives of real people who are being misled and managed by others. Here is the article from the Guardian. 5G and QAnon: how conspiracy theorists steered Canadaâ€™s anti-vaccine trucker protest Ottawaâ€™s occupation was a result of unrivaled coordination between anti-vax and anti-government organizations Justin Ling in Montreal Published: 08:16 Tuesday, 08 February 2022 Thousands of demonstrators have successfully occupied Canadaâ€™s frigid capital for days, and say they plan on staying as long as it takes to thwart the countryâ€™s vaccine requirements. Ottawa protesters defy growing calls to end occupation of capital The brazen occupation of Ottawa came as a result of unprecedented coordination between various anti-vaccine and anti-government organizations and activists, and has been seized on by similar groups around the world. It may herald the revenge of the anti-vaxxers. The so-called â€œfreedom convoyâ€ â€“ which departed for Ottawa on 23 January â€“ was the brainchild of James Bauder, an admitted conspiracy theorist who has endorsed the QAnon movement and called Covid-19 â€œthe biggest political scam in historyâ€. Bauderâ€™s group, Canada Unity, contends that vaccine mandates and passports are illegal under Canadaâ€™s constitution, the Nuremberg Code and a host of other international conventions. Bauder has long been a fringe figure, but his movement caught a gulf stream of support after the prime minister, Justin Trudeau, announced last year that truckers crossing the US-Canada border would need to be fully vaccinated against Covid-19. The supposed plight of the truckers proved to be a compelling public relations angle and attracted an array of fellow travelers. Until now, a litany of organizations had protested Canadaâ€™s strict public health measures, but largely in isolation. One such group, Hold Fast Canada, had organized pickets of the Canadian Broadcasting Corporationâ€™s headquarters, where they claimed that concentration camps had already been introduced in the country. Another group, Action4Canada, launched legal challenges to mask and vaccine mandates. In one 400-page court filing, they allege that the â€œfalse pronouncement of a Covid-19 â€˜pandemicâ€™â€ was carried out, at least in part, by Bill Gates and a â€œNew World (Economic) Orderâ€ to facilitate the injection of 5G-enabled microchips into the population. Both groups are listed as â€œparticipating groupsâ€ on the Canada Unity website, and sent vehicles and personnel to join the convoy. Other organizers joined Bauder, including Chris Barber, a Saskatchewan trucker who was fined $14,000 in October for violating provincial public health measures; Tamara Lich, an activist for a fringe political party advocating that western Canada should become an independent state; Benjamin Dichter, who has warned of the â€œgrowing Islamization of Canadaâ€; and Pat King, an anti-government agitator who has repeatedly called for Trudeau to be arrested. Since they have arrived in Ottawa, the extreme elements of the protest have been visible: neo-Nazi and Confederate flags were seen flying, QAnon logos were emblazoned on trucks and signs and stickers were pasted to telephone poles around the occupied area bear Trudeauâ€™s face, reading: â€œWanted for crimes against humanity.â€ The official line from Bauder and his co-organizers, however, has remained focused; in a Facebook live broadcast, Bauder instructed his supporters to â€œstop talking about the vaccineâ€ and instead stick to message of â€œfreedomâ€. Such strict message control has attracted mainstream support. Numerous members of the Conservative party, Canadaâ€™s official opposition, have come out to meet the protesters. Elon Musk and Donald Trump have both endorsed the convoy. Fox broadcasters Sean Hannity and Tucker Carlson have provided glowing updates on the continuing occupation. Bauder vowed the convoy would camp out in Ottawa until their demands are met, insisting to his followers that a â€œmemorandum of understandingâ€ would force the governmentâ€™s hand, possibly even triggering fresh elections, if enough people sign. A Canada Unity organizer went further, saying it would require the Senate to â€œgo after the prime ministerâ€ for â€œcorruptionâ€ and â€œfascismâ€. There is no legal basis for those claims. King has laid out a more direct plan of action to the occupiers: â€œWhat we want to focus on is our politicians, their houses, their locations,â€ he said in a January Facebook stream. If political pressure doesnâ€™t work, King said, blocking major supply chains â€œwill be later onâ€. Soon after, the head of security for parliament issued an extraordinary warning to members of parliament to avoid the protest entirely, for their (truncated)

column1: 1,000,000 Strong Against The Liberal National Party
column30: Upcoming mobilization to counter the upcoming far-right lead anti-vaccination rally with a message of anti-fascism and social solidarity. Check it out and come along if you can!
column34: PROTEST: Stop the far right in Melbourne!
column35:
This is organised as a COVID-19 safe event. All participants are requested to come fully vaccinated and wearing masks.

Join the Campaign Against Racism and Fascism in Melbourne to protest the far-right trying to march in our streets, as part of a national day of anti-fascist action. Let everyone know that Melbourne is an anti-fascist zone! 

On November 20 the far right will be holding another rally. Those organising the protest are linked up with other far-right movements around the world. Their politics are deeply reactionary. They stand against public health measures including the restrictions and vaccines that have saved countless lives. While our hospitals and healthcare workers are being overrun, they celebrate selfish individualism that would see the bodies pile high as the virus rips through the community unabated. 

This far-right worldview is intensely anti-human. It has seen protesters spit on Melbourneâ€™s healthcare workers, shout racist abuse at Aboriginal people who oppose them, and close down a vaccination hub that services the homeless.  

The upcoming protest is organised by Melbourne Freedom Rally, a shadowy outfit led by Harrison McLean.  McLean was recently exposed for plotting to use COVID-19 scepticism to walk people towards far-right fringe conspiracism and the â€œJewish questionâ€. Supporters include Reignite Democracy Australia, the electoralist arm of the movement who have recently teamed up with Clive Palmer and Craig Kelly to create a new far-right force in Australian politics. Proud Boys, a neo-fascist, misogynist and anti-trans all-male group are regular attendees at these protests, seeing them as a fertile breeding ground for their ideas.

These figures are drawing inspiration and encouragement from far-right advances around the world. In October, a like-minded mob of fascists physically attacked and destroyed trade union offices in Rome. In New York, anti-vax protesters tore down a COVID-19 testing tent.  When the far right advances like this, it is an immediate threat to people of colour, women, and LGBTI people, who are set within their crosshairs. This vile scum must be opposed by ordinary people.

Relentless counter-protests were how we defeated the far-right Reclaim Australia movement in 2015. To defeat the fascists this time we must build our forces and politically counter them. CARF is organising a counter-demonstration against the far right on November 20 to show public opposition to these views and organisations. We call on all anti-fascists and all those who support public health to join our rally and build the movement against the far right.

column30: Lots of misinformation on vaccines circling, so including an in-depth science piece for Colorado Newsline: https://coloradonewsline.com/2020/12/16/what-is-a-modrna-vaccine-and-is-it-safe/ Key takeaways: - The vaccine has only 10 ingredients: 4 fats, 4 salts, 1 sugar and modRNA (explained in article). - No preservatives: For elected officials, please know the preservative is often what the anti-vax crew says causes Autism. While science doesn't support this, it doesn't matter for this vaccine as preservatives are not necessary for this new technology, so they aren't included â€” you have a great talking point here for constituents, happy to discuss further if you have questions! - The vaccine cannot edit human genes, and it is broken down quickly in the body. - This new technology works off established science dating back decades. Safety protocols were not compromised. - The U.S. gov't did not fund any R&D for the Pfizer vaccine, it was funded by Germany under Chancellor and scientist Angela Merkel. - Herd immunity (explained in the piece) for COVID-19 might require ~70% vaccination rates â€” we will not achieve this anytime soon, and may struggle to reach it at all this coming year if more people don't become willing to take it â€” 58% per polling is well below.

column1: Toward a Federal Liberal Government - ForwardForEveryone
column30: # **Beware the convoy â€“ It appears as a western fifth column to take down Canada.** The â€˜Freedom Convoyâ€™ has been a disgusting stain foisted on Canada by western separatists. The truckers and their entourage were parking around the Cenotaph, prancing (and pissing) in the snow on the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier, waving Nazi flags, hanging an anti-vax post on the Terry Fox monument, mooching free meals from a soup kitchen, and screaming at the media covering the protest. This was a western super spreader event that will drive covid numbers up in Ontario. If this disgrace is not dealt with firmly, it could drive Canada towards anti-democratic illiberalism and the breakdown of public trust in its institutions. These truckers are not ordinary protesters, theyâ€™re hopeless. Protests have been premised on a simple principle: â€œThe government isnâ€™t living up to its own laws, or its laws undercut its claims of justice and fairness for all. The protest is intended to bring out thousands of people to shame the government into respecting its own proclaimed beliefs in justice, equality, freedom, the rule of law.â€ These truckers have disregarded those principles. The reasons for their cross-country convoy morphed from day to day, hour to hour. â€œFreedomâ€ from vaccination vanished; now it was the whole public health response that had to go, and never mind that the federal government canâ€™t much influence the provinces on such issues. Then a strange alliance of the Governor-General and the Senate was supposed to oust Justin Trudeau and then what? Hand the country over to the truckers? These truckers and their organizers donâ€™t seem to have a very clear sense of any kind of history. They did know that swastikas trigger people, like a thumbtack on the teacherâ€™s chair. They wanted to â€œownâ€ us, get a rise out of us, by telling us how little they shared of our values. Weâ€™ve seen this show evolve six years ago south of the border. Trump could insult and undermine American institutions, and persuade Americans that some weird Deep State had taken over their country, from the media to the FBI to the electoral system. He didnâ€™t have to marshal arguments, cite authorities, or otherwise try to persuade skeptics. You could just dump on anyone who didnâ€™t agree with you. There was no logic and he gave America â€œhate as a faith.â€ So the truckers and their supporters have behaved very badly to challenge Canadians who respect and trust in their institutions. You admire Terry Fox? We couldnâ€™t care less. You respect our fallen soldiers? Piss on them. Youâ€™re in the media? We donâ€™t need to give you a sound bite about what we want â€” just a few seconds of abusing you as a stooge of a lying newspaper or broadcaster. The same disrespect went out to every healthcare worker, every teacher, and every civil servant. Make their jobs harder, push them to burn out and quit so the hospitals and schools and governments canâ€™t function as well. No one knows whatâ€™s true anymore, which is a precondition for fascism. The Freedom Convoy, then, is a deliberate provocation, a test of the municipal and federal governments: Weâ€™ll show you what we think of you and your sacred institutions. Now, what are you going to do about it? Trudeau senior would have said â€œJust watch me,â€ and called in the army. Jagmeet Singh has confined himself to severe disapproval of â€œvile, violent and hateful behaviour.â€ The truckers have also effectively neutered the Conservative Party of Canada. Erin Oâ€™Toole could neither reject them nor endorse them, just as he couldnâ€™t come out for or against vaccination. Meanwhile, Maxime Bernierâ€™s Peopleâ€™s Party of Canada was in the thick of it and likely signing up plenty of members. Our governments seem to have made a disastrous misjudgment. Where the truckers and their supporters are violating laws, they should be promptly arrested. These arrests should continue as long as needed and it would show Canada and the world that weâ€™re serious about peace, order and good government and public health as well. Justice delayed is justice denied for such people. Worse yet, justice is both denied and discredited for the rest of us.

column34: This is a re-share of a post
column35:
Covid-19: Once bitten twice shy?

I refer to the article '48 new locally transmitted Covid-19 cases in S'pore, including 9 unlinked' (ST, 16 Aug)

It states that ""There were also five imported cases that were detected and isolated upon arrival in Singapore."" It may also be useful to note that the number of imported cases have been rising steadily in the past 3 days, from 1 to 3 to today's 5.

This increased number may, arguably, be due to the fact that fully vaccinated work pass holders and their dependents from higher-risk countries have been allowed to enter Singapore from 10 Aug onwards.

In this connection, it has been reported that it is not difficult for residents of higher risk countries to easily purchase fake vaccinations and PCR Covid-19 tests for as little as $100. (""Delta variant drives fake Covid vax certificates on Telegram""; The Indian Tribune, 11 Aug).

Furthermore, slightly over two months ago, we heard the Minister Ong Ye Kung say that covid-19 ""broke through'' the layers of defence at Changi Airport. This was believed to be the first incident which led to the Phase 3 Heightened Alert from 16 May to 13 Jun.

The May incident happened even though more than 90% of workers at Changi Airport have been vaccinated. The article states that ""Of the first 20-odd infections detected at the airport, most had congregated around one zone.""

It also states that ""From that zone, workers go have their lunch, go have their meals at the Terminal 3 basement 2 commercial areas and the food court. And we suspect from there, it transmitted to members of the public that visited the place.""

('Virulent' mutant virus 'broke through' Changi Airport defences: Ong Ye Kung ""Yahoo Singapore, 14 May).

Now, countries are not just struggling with the Delta variant but there is also a new Lamada version which is known to be resistant to the vaccine!

For most people, it would have been ""once bitten, twice shy"". However, for the multi-ministry task force, it seems that their opening up of the borders, may be more than what most people are comfortable with.

Itâ€™s our right as Americans to breathe the open air without wearing some wussy libtard face diaper, just as itâ€™s our right to die intubated in a hospital. Itâ€™s all about your freedom, baby. Gov. Ron DeSantis and the fine MAGA folks of the Florida Legislature are right here in the state capital, passing laws telling Biden where he can stick that order making businesses with more than 100 employees mandate the vax. And yeah, it might cost the taxpayers several million for the lawsuits thatâ€™ll come out of these new bills, but keeping Florida free is worth every penny. Anyway, they can take it from the education budget. A surgical mask and a KN95 mask hang on display for sale at a pharmacy. Photo by Sean Gallup/Getty Images. And if your boss orders you to get the jab, you can say you have a religious objection or maybe youâ€™re pregnant or maybe youâ€™d rather stick a swab up your nose a couple times a week and wear a hazmat suitâ€“which your employer has to buy for you. One of the new laws will give the gov $1 million to help create our very own FLOSHA. The Chamber of Commerce likes it. So what if itâ€™ll take years to launch, and Florida canâ€™t do it without the fedsâ€™ permission? By then, Ron DeSantis will be president-for-life. The state took money from the schools boards because they wouldnâ€™t do what the governor said. Donâ€™t those teachers understand they work for him? The professors at U.F. couldnâ€™t testify in court because what they said might harm the governorâ€™s excellent voting bills, and nobody wants that, right? Meanwhile, back at the special session, that fine young righteous Right fellow Ben Shapiro, who was in town to speak on the mega-woke, conservative-repressing Florida State campus, got a tour of the House chamber from House Speaker Chris Sprowls while hordes of patriots spoke in favor of telling Washington to butt out â€” right after they give us the $13 billion in infrastructure cash. It was quite the lib slap-down in the hallowed halls of the Legislature! You had doctors from Hawaii and even Cleveland, Ohio, showing up to witness how the feds are trying to destroy America. One declared that â€œfascists from D.C.â€ want us to take these â€œdangerous and experimental drugsâ€ as part of a â€œblitzkrieg against our freedom.â€ You had Dr. Jeffrey Mueller of Orlando warning that we donâ€™t really know anything about these vaccines, despite all the so-called medical trials, the scientific evidence, and the recommendations of the FDA, the CDC, the NIH, and the rest of the Deep Staters who want to crush the neck of Liberty under the jackboot of Science. column30: Anti-vax radio host Marc Bernier has died after being hospitalized for COVID-19. ""It's with great sadness that WNDB and Southern Stone Communications announce the passing of Marc Bernier. column30: ""This is the Selfish Surge. It's a surge that's been incubated by the self-centered and the partisan. If conservatives had been as willing to take safety precautions equivalent to the ones nonconservative Americans were willing to take, it would not currently exist. If Republican politicians, public anti-vax influencers, and random flag-waving hucksters had not vigorously belittled pandemic safety measures for months on end, Americans who listened to their words would not be riding the front of a new record number of deaths. If Tucker Carlson, Sean Hannity and other hoax-promoting pundits had decided that no, getting vaccinated against a new disease was not in fact a conspiracy against them, conservative regions of America would not now be in crisis. Those are the Americans that vaccinated Americans are mad at. We have all sacrificed for, at this point, a year and a half in order to beat back an illness that we knew we could win against if everyone participated. Most of us know people who have died in the pandemic. Some of us know many people who have died. Americans have lost their jobs, their businesses, their homes, and their family members, all while other Americans mount flags to their trucks, strap guns to their waists and have glorious public shit-fits over the indignity of having to wear a scrap of cloth that blocks their spittle during a pandemic that cost 600,000 other Americans their lives.""

R.I.P.

And the safety considerations for the seat belt laws are used to compare without considering: 

1. Seatbelt laws do not require your employer to ask proof you wore your seatbelt driving to work, lest you be fired, dishonorably discharged.
2. You don't have to wear a seatbelt everywhere you go, while you're sleeping and buckle up to enter a coffee shop.
3. There's no concerted effort to mobilize all facets of media to challenge anyone who suggests Airbags work just as well be canceled and tossed into the 3rd rail of societal conspiracy.
4. Seatbelts laws don't get rewritten every 3 weeks with new guidelines and mandates. 
5. Seatbelt proponents don't declare martial law when a group is seen not wearing them.
6. Seatbelt studies and data have not been manipulated and altered to skew data for justification.
7. There is not a polarized, political fixation on the issue of buckling up where one who doesn't wear one is ostracized from their family and advised by the Dept. of Transportation not to drive a car.
8. The only way to create a seatbelt parallel to these vaccines would be a seatbelt law requiring everyone, whether or not a vehicle operator, to wear a 5-point, flame retardant racing harness while sitting parked in their living room lounge chair...

column30: I've decided to try to extend my opinion on covid-19 by posting in all of the groups I follow. When tuberculosis (TB) was rampant in the United States of America, people who exhibited any symptoms or tested positive were hospitalized in Tuberculosis Sanitariums. If they refused they were forcibly hospitalized there until they were cured. Until leprosy was understood, people with it (lepers) were shunned and forced out of cities to survive on their own. Covid-19 is still not fully understood, but anybody with an understanding of how medications are approved for use by the medical community in the United States of America knows that their first concern is do no harm. Then they begin the process of approving for trials where the stated purpose for the medications is tested in controlled conditions. The covid-19 vaccine development used mrna research to quickly develop the primary vaccines we use in the United States of America. They had a significant head start on vaccine development. That meant vaccine development didn't start from the very beginning, but focused on utilizing mrna as the delivery system. Trials began much faster than normal because of the head start mrna gave them and because Operation Warp Speed created focus on a vaccine for covid-19 by all pharmaceutical and health research organizations. I have a small pox vaccination scar, but my grandchildren don't. I have had multiple tuberculosis tests, but I don't know that my grandchildren have had any unless required by their environment. My mom took me to get the Salk polio vaccine the first time I could get it. I've had measles, for which I continue to suffer because of the virus it left in my body. My grandchildren have not. Public health is a great thing until it inconveniences us. Peanut products are excluded from many classrooms because a child might have a life-threatening allergic reaction. Public schools require proof of vaccination for several diseases. Covid-19 is just one more thing to make schools safer for students, teachers and all other staff. When I worked in surgery and other health care settings, I was often required to wear a mask. If the doctor required masks I wore one. Otherwise I was expelled from the room because my refusal wasn't in the best health interest of everyone else in the room. If an infection was discovered in the Healthcare facility, every protocol was stepped up by at least a factor of 10. We not only protected the patient and ourselves, but everybody in the building complex. I've written all of this to nudge you to think about others, students, teachers and all staff. Hopefully that will get you to the decisions to do your part to protect the most people. We can get through this just as we in the United States of America have been able to survive previous health scares. Vax up! Mask up! It will get us back to some normalcy until we beat covid-19 and all its variants. Peace

Takei's statements came as hospitals are canceling so-called ""elective"" procedures as the unvaccinated clog up healthcare systems. ""This is an update from an earlier position taken by MOM and its tripartite partners - the National Trades Union Congress and the Singapore National Employers Federation. On Jul 2, a joint advisory said employers may impose a vaccination requirement for workplaces that are considered to have a higher risk of Covid-19 infection, but staff should not be penalised if they decline vaccination. In its latest advisory on Covid-19 vaccination at the workplace, MOM said for work that can be performed at home, employers may allow unvaccinated workers to work remotely at their prerogative. However, it added: ""As the vast majority of vaccinated employees eventually return to the workplace more frequently, the prolonged absence of the unvaccinated employees from the workplace may affect their individual performance as well as negatively impact team or organisational performance."" As for work that cannot be performed at home, MOM said employers can allow them to continue in their existing job with pre-event testing done at the employees' own expense, or such staff may be redeployed to suitable jobs that can be done from home. As a last resort, however, they may be placed on no-pay leave or terminated with notice in accordance with their employment project. ""If termination of employment is due to employees' inability to be at the workplace to perform their contracted work, such termination of employment would not be considered as wrongful dismissal,"" MOM said. https://www.businesstimes.com.sg/government-economy/no-vax-no-hire-employers-can-also-terminate-unvaccinated-workers-as-last-resort? * URL of MOM updated advisory: https://www.mom.gov.sg/covid-19/advisory-on-covid-19-vaccination-in-employment-settings?

column30: # **Canada Unityâ€™s truck convoy is becoming a real problem for Canada's CPC.** Candice Bergen and Pierre Poilievre (PP for short) jumped for joy as they unceremoniously dumped Erin Oâ€™Tooleâ€™s leadership. Both were out there taking selfies with the â€˜Freedom Convoyâ€™ and touting their support for them. Unfortunately, they couldnâ€™t care less for the more than one-million Ottawa citizens who were physically, mentally and emotionally abused for the last two weeks. â€œHundreds of devoted members of the anti-vax trucker convoy have paralyzed Ottawaâ€™s downtown core, blared their horns incessantly, and harassed residents. Convoy members have flown flags with swastikas, taken a shit on a lawn adorned with a pride flag, and are allegedly responsible for 200 reported hate crimes. Ottawa is currently in a state of emergency. Elsewhere, protesters have shut down two of the busiest ports of entry on the US-Canada border.â€ The CPC viewpoint was demonstrated when PP wrote on Twitter. â€œBright, joyful, and peaceful Canadians championing freedom over fear on Parliament Hill.â€ PP is but one of several Tory politicians whoâ€™ve voiced unequivocal support for the protests, which have not been all that peaceful. Of course, no one is paying attention to Bergenâ€™s waffling in her position. Now sheâ€™s proudly announcing in the house, â€œthat the protest is over and the protestors should go home.â€ This kind of flip-flop cost Oâ€™Toole his job. We will all look back and appreciate how a more moderate leader he was. So, what will the CPC morph into now? A fiscally conservative but socially progressive party, like what Oâ€™Toole was trying to create or a party thatâ€™s decidedly more to the right, and taps into the same anti-government anger Donald Trump exploited. This has the potential to backfire on the CPC and on all Canadians, too. Conservatives donâ€™t seem to have any boundaries. Conservative leaders havenâ€™t concretely defined the Conservative Partyâ€™s values. So, you have MPs like Oâ€™Toole taking a more hard-line stance against racism, while other MPs try to avoid the subject. The CPC as a whole is failing to condemn fringe, far-right values promoted by some of the convoyâ€™s leaders. CPC MPs are â€œplaying footsiesâ€ with extremists â€œbecause they donâ€™t want to lose a potential voter or donor.â€ Bergen claims the CPC has a big tent. This tent now includes the Far Right. The so-called â€œfreedom convoyâ€ was the brainchild of James Bauder, an admitted conspiracy theorist who has endorsed the QAnon movement and called Covid-19 â€œthe biggest political scam in historyâ€. Bauderâ€™s group, Canada Unity, contends that vaccine mandates and passports are illegal under Canadaâ€™s constitution, the Nuremberg Code and a host of other international conventions. Before â€˜Canada Unity,â€™ there were many smaller protest groups protesting covid mandates. Bauder successfully coalesced them under the â€˜Canada Unityâ€™ banner and fine-tuned their protest to parrot a single message line, â€˜Freedomâ€™. This made it more readily acceptable to those that were unhappy with mandates and for those westerners who also hated Eastern Canada. These groups included: Hold Fast Canada (they believed that concentration camps had been set up in Canada; they protested the CBC); Action4Canada (launched legal challenges to mask and vaccine mandates; They believed Bill Gates and a â€˜New World Economic Order falsely established a covid pandemic so as to inject everyone with 5G-enabled microchips); Chris Barber (a Saskatchewan trucker who was fined $14,000 in October for violating provincial public health measures); Tamara Lich (an activist for a fringe political party advocating that western Canada should become an independent state); Benjamin Dichter (who has warned of the â€œgrowing Islamization of Canadaâ€); and Pat King (an anti-government agitator who has repeatedly called for Trudeau to be arrested). The world has seen the extreme elements of the Ottawa protest flying these banners: neo-Nazi and Confederate flags were seen flying; QAnon logos were emblazoned on trucks and signs; and stickers were pasted to telephone poles around the occupied area that bear Trudeauâ€™s face, reading: â€œWanted for crimes against humanity.â€ The official line from Bauder and his co-organizers, however, has remained focused; in a Facebook live broadcast, Bauder instructed his supporters to â€œstop talking about the vaccineâ€ and instead stick to the message of â€œfreedomâ€. Such strict message control has sucked in mainstream support. Numerous members of the Conservative party, Canadaâ€™s official opposition, have come out to meet the protesters. Elon Musk and Donald Trump have both endorsed the convoy. Fox broadcasters Sean Hannity and Tucker Carlson have provided glowing updates on the continuing occupation. Bauder vowed the convoy would camp out in Ottawa until their demands are met, insisting to his followers that a â€œmemorandum of understandingâ€ would force the governmentâ€™s hand, possibly even triggering fresh elections, if (truncated)

column30: ""So far this year, freshman Representative Marjorie Taylor Greene has outraised all of her GOP colleagues in the House, raking in $4.53 million in the first six months of 2021. (Among congressional Republicans, only Senators Ted Cruz and Josh Hawley have raised more.) Yes, Greene is paying quite a bit to raise those funds, but it remains a staggering amount for an incumbent in a safe red district, especially when most of it has come from small donors. **What on earth do people think theyâ€™re buying with that money?** **One thing her donors are definitely not buying is a coherent political message.** Last week, after being suspended by Twitter for 12 hours for falsely claiming that there had been â€œ6,000 vax-related deaths,â€ she held a press conference in which she repeatedly contradicted herself, arguing at one point that the number was actually higher, while also appearing to agree with her colleague Steve Scalise that the vaccine is safe and effective. Asked by reporters for her actual beliefs, Greene deflected, embracing instead the mantra of conspiracy theorists everywhere: Do your own research. â€œI encourage people to make up their own mind,â€ she said at one point, before echoing a few minutes later the old conspiracy theoristâ€™s standard that someone should be looking into all of this: â€œYou see, thereâ€™s a lot of things happening and I think we should analyze all of it before governments and schools and businesses say, â€˜Absolutely, you have to take this vaccine.â€™ **What Greene is offeringâ€”and what her supporters are buyingâ€”is not an alternative theory but rather freedom: the freedom to disregard acknowledged authorities like Anthony Fauci, and the freedom to come to your own conclusions.** **Although we tend to think of conspiracy theories as dark, paranoid, and unsettling, for the conspiracist they can be quite liberating, because they free you from having to accept things you donâ€™t want to believe.** Writing about rumor and urban legend in America, the **sociologists Gary Alan Fine and Patricia A. Turner borrow a phrase from the French anthropologist Claude LÃ©vi-Strauss, who has said that some ideas are simply â€œgood to think.â€ That is, we subscribe to some ideas not necessarily because theyâ€™re true (or defensible) but because the simple act of believing them brings a kind of reassurance and pleasure.** As Fine and Turner note, urban legends and conspiracy theories are good to think because â€œthey connect to a powerful â€˜cultural logicâ€™ that makes sense to narrators and audiences. Plausibility is key. Rumor permits us to project our emotional fantasies on events that we can claim â€˜really did happen,â€™ protecting ourselves from the implications of our beliefs.â€ **By rejecting the dominant narrative without providing a substantive replacement, Greene offers her audience the freedom to cherry-pick sources and devise a narrative that best fits their biases, disregarding anything that collides with their worldview.""** ... ""**If we can recognize that the real gift Greene is offering is not misinformation so much as it is freedom, we might be able to approach the problem of misinformation differently**, particularly surrounding COVID-19 and vaccines. Researchers have known for years that shaming people to get vaccinated often ends up backfiring, and that much of this is because vaccine resistance is heavily correlated with notions of personal liberty. **The people weâ€™re trying to reach are not motivated to act on behalf of others, and they wonâ€™t respond to exhortations of civic responsibility.** **If Greeneâ€™s supporters want freedom without repercussions, focusing on consequences for this freedom might give us more leverage than we might think, particularly if we can shift the focus from â€œfreedom versus obligationâ€â€”the way conspiracists like Greene prefer to frame the issueâ€”to differing kinds of freedom.** Vaccines offer us the freedom to participate, the freedom to circulate back in the world, the freedom to be human again. The Washington Post, for example, reported on one vaccine holdout who got her shot so she could attend New York Yankees games in person. When The Dallas Morning News asked prominent citizens of North Dallas why they got vaccinated, some spoke in terms of obligation and protecting others. But others spoke of the possibilities associated with the vaccines. **Robert Jeffress, the pastor at First Baptist Church, echoed Greeneâ€™s line at first, stating that â€œwe are not trying to force anyone to be vaccinatedâ€”that is a personal choice,â€ but he went on to say that vaccination is â€œthe quickest way for Christians to come back to church safely so that we can enjoy the encouragement we all need that comes from worshipping together.â€** Itâ€™s a tricky but promising rhetorical move: You can choose to do whatever you want, but the rest of the world is waiting for you if you choose to get vaccinated."" ... ""**Greene will continue to push the rhetorical move that Americans deserve not just freedom but (truncated)

column34: Richard
column35:
DATELINE RBNews 2021, October 21â€“ Sonoma, Calif.

I was told they had a tad more than a hundred members, and it seemed like most of them showed up for The Sonoma Valley Democratsâ€™ â€œFriendraiserâ€ fundraiser yesterday in Sonoma. The nearest equivalent in my Napa Democratic experience touches on Democrats of Napa Valleyâ€™s (DONV) sometimes Christmas Party, or an election watch with a good ending. DONVâ€™s general meetings and rallies approach a similar atmosphere; it all seemed familiar in an unfamiliar sort of way. 

The closest parallel would be one of Congressman Mike Thompsonâ€™s Pasta Feeds, or one of his drive-in movie theatre experience.

First of all, upon entry to the building, the Sonoma Dems checked for proof of vaccination for covid-19. No one was allowed in without having been vaccinated. Absolutely spot on. My vax record is on my cell phone, downloaded from the state covid health records.

Second, attendees were welcomed by the music of a talented trioâ€“ a man on bass guitar, a woman playing violin and singing;, and a man on acoustic guitar and singing.  The group had an interesting moniker â€“ Kevin Russell and his Familiar Strangers, with Candy Girard â€“ fiddle, vocals & killer smile; Tim Sarter â€“ bass, vocals & infectious friendliness; and the man himself Kevin Russell â€“ guitar, vocals & set list maker. (THANKS Beth Hadley, for the names and other information.)

Their upbeat style ranged from the â€œFrench Jazzâ€ evolved by Django Reinhardt and StÃ©phane Grappelli to early Linda Ronstadt. I liked them a lot, and could have stayed a couple more hours if they were allowed to play longer.

Our own Traci Krumpen made the trek to Sonoma to represent  Cecilia Aguiar-Curry, who could not attend because sheâ€™s in Portugal talking with the government about their very success wind-energy program.

State Senator Bill Dodd was represented by a young Dodd staffer named Logan Pitts. The same was true of Rebecca Hermosillo, who spoke on behalf of Congressman Mike Thompson, who is in â€œD.C.â€ trying to keep our democracy intact.

Carl Tannenbaum, A candidate for Sheriff of Sonoma County spoke about his candidacy, touting his record as police Sergeant and a twenty-year career in San Francisco, until retirement from that police force. He spoke a bit about new attitudes and unification within, and between, departments, and of his commitment to justice. On first meeting and greeting, brief as it was, I liked him.

Traci Krumpen also had come to support a candidate for Sonoma City Council, Sandra Lowe, who described herself as committed and a practical progressive ready to do her bit. She was energized and convincing.

The Sonoma Dems put out a superb snackage table, and in the spirit of the Halloween season, decorated the Heritage Hallâ€™s tables with autumn colors and flowers, and festoons  with bite-sized candy bars, packaged nuts, a bottle each of local red and white wines. 

The officers of the Dem Club moved about and welcomed new members (me, e.g.: the $20 admission donation was also counted as membership dues.)

This was a terrific group of people and I would like to see a joining of efforts with them at some point in 2022 as things grow feisty in the coming campaign year. They do post-carding, phone banking, door-to-door canvasing. Imagine  them joining us on a phone bank or post-carding event, and then. us returning the effort. 

We are geographical neighbors who have shared and suffered much the same disasters as we have in the last few years. We are also political neighbors who share the same goals, and the same fears, for our country in the elections of 2022 and 2024. We really should get to know each other. And I believe they have the right idea about mandatory vaccinations for covid before being allowed into an indoor group setting where masks would have to be set aside temporarily while eating and/or consuming some of the tasty fermented grape juice.

The venue for this happening was called the Heritage Hall, and is a part of a Finnish-American housing complex where Fin heritage is required for residency. The hall was large and had a small inset stage, a side dining area, and a kitchen.

After the brief comments by the various speakers, a raffle was held: one prize of a three-course dinner for two at the Plaza Bistro, coincidentally once co-owned by a racquetball student of mine, with his brother. My student sold his interest to his brother ten, twelve years ago, and I havenâ€™t been back there since â€¦ but the food was very good then â€¦ I trust it still is.

There was one other prize, a bottle of red wine. Following the raffle, the trio got back on stage and played again, and people slowly drifted away.

The evening had the feeling that politics are supposed to have: of community; of camaraderie, of shared goals and the will to plow through the merde to get to the cookies.

Definitely a welcome relief from some of the antics weâ€™ve all witnessed in the last five years. The next two elections are critical â€“ (truncated)

""Night after night, the host of the top-rated show on Fox News repeats Vladimir Putinâ€™s talking points justifying [aggression against Ukraine](https://www.theatlantic.com/international/archive/2022/01/putin-ukraine-battle-west/621361/) and opposing U.S. aid to that threatened sovereign country. [Tucker Carlsonâ€™s influence](https://www.theatlantic.com/ideas/archive/2021/12/why-tucker-carlson-defending-alex-jones/620906/) is felt across right-wing social media, where it is amplified by figures such as Steve Bannon, Mike Cernovich, Glenn Greenwald, and Mollie Hemingway. A [highly visible](https://www.theamericanconservative.com/dreher/ukraine-war-this-time-its-different/) [coterie](https://www.nytimes.com/2022/01/22/opinion/russia-ukraine-us-nato.html) of socially conservative intellectuals also argues the case against helping Ukraine. Meanwhile, day after day, Republican officeholders in the House and the Senate urge *more* support for Ukraine. That list includes not only traditionalists such as [Senator Roger Wicker of Mississippi](https://www.wicker.senate.gov/2022/1/wicker-colleagues-push-for-strong-defense-of-ukraine/ea571c3b-2e35-4f82-8c2e-16c652b03c0d), but also many legislators who got close to former President Donald Trump, such as Senators [Tom Cotton](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mcBU_HrBCqQ), [Ted Cruz](https://www.cruz.senate.gov/newsroom/press-releases/sen-cruz-on-upcoming-nord-stream-2-vote-the-eyes-of-history-are-upon-us), and [Lindsey Graham](https://www.counton2.com/news/national-news/sen-lindsey-graham-calls-for-more-ukraine-support-immediate-sanctions-on-russia/). [Mitch McConnell](https://www.newsweek.com/mitch-mcconnell-praises-joe-biden-moving-right-direction-ukraine-1672785), the top Republican in the Senate, has backed the Biden administrationâ€™s approach, as have [the top Republicans](https://turner.house.gov/2021/11/turner-and-rogers-urges-president-biden-to-take-action-at-the-ukrainian-russian-border) on the House Intelligence and Armed Services Committees. House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy has blasted Joe Bidenâ€™s Ukraine policy as [too weak on Russia, not too strong](https://twitter.com/GOPLeader/status/1484542203825381381?s=20). **There are exceptions to the pro-Ukraine norm among Republican elected officials.** [Rand Paul](https://www.courier-journal.com/story/opinion/2022/01/26/rand-paul-how-we-prevent-war-ukraine-opinion/9226398002/) in the Senate and [Paul Gosar](https://prescottenews.com/index.php/2022/01/27/we-have-no-dog-in-the-ukraine-fight-rep-paul-gosar/) in the House have dissented. **Some next-generation Republican office seekers, especially those backed by the Republican mega-donor Peter Thiel, have also followed the Carlson-Bannon-Greenwald line. **They include [J. D. Vance](https://twitter.com/JDVance1/status/1486381699130920965), who is seeking the Republican nomination for the U.S. Senate in Ohio, and [Blake Masters](https://www.axios.com/activist-republicans-oppose-helping-ukraine-7311d46f-49fc-47b5-af46-f365c4e7809d.html), who is seeking the Republican nomination for the U.S. Senate in Arizona. Eric Greitensâ€”the disgraced former governor of Missouri now running for the Republican nomination in the U.S. Senate race thereâ€”has issued vividly inflammatory statements against aid to Ukraine as â€œthe war mongering of DC elites.â€ But broadly, Republican elected officials and the think tanks that advise them are staunchly pro-Ukraine; conservative talkers (especially on TV and social media) are varying degrees of anti-Ukraine. Russia-Ukraine is becoming a trial of strength, not only between [Putin and NATO](https://www.theatlantic.com/international/archive/2021/12/russia-putin-ukraine-invasion/621140/), but between different parts of the conservative world. Over the past half-dozen years, such intra-conservative disputes have usually ended in abject defeat for Republican elected officials. In *New York* magazine this week, for example, Jonathan Chait [details](https://nymag.com/intelligencer/article/anti-vaccine-republican-party-desantis-tucker-carlson.html) the long, slow yielding of Republican politicians to anti-vax delusions."" ... ""Trump, who in the past was always ready to speak warmly of Putin, may sense that neither the American public nor the majority of his own party is with the Fox News universe on aiding Ukraine. He released a vague statement limited to bragging nonspecifically that the crisis at the Ukraine-Russia border [would not be happening](https://twitter.com/realLizUSA/status/1485647465823023105) if he were still president, edging away from his anti-Ukraine media allies. Florida Governor Ron Desantis, a would-be Trump successor, has made [no statement](https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2022/01/27/there-are-already-small-number-us-troops-ukraine-they-florida-national-guard/) on (truncated)

column30: ""Facebook is allowing users to profit from the spread of potentially dangerous false theories and misinformation about the pandemic and vaccines, including deploying money-raising tools on pages with content flagged up by the social media giantâ€™s own factcheckers. An investigation has found 430 pages â€“ followed by 45 million people â€“ using Facebookâ€™s tools, including virtual â€œshopsâ€ and fan subscriptions, while spreading false information about Covid-19 or vaccinations. The findings come despite a promise the platform made last year that no user or company should directly profit from false information about immunisation against Covid-19. Facebook generally does not share this income, but it does occasionally take a cut, and benefits financially from users engaging with content and staying on its services, exposing them to more ads. The research, by the London-headquartered Bureau of Investigative Journalism, is likely to have uncovered only a tiny snapshot of the vast amount of monetised misinformation on Facebook related to the pandemic and vaccines."" ... ""More than 260 of the pages the bureau identified have posted misinformation about vaccines. The remainder include false information on the pandemic, on vaccines more broadly, or a combination of the two. More than 20 pages identified have gained Facebookâ€™s blue tick signalling authenticity. For Facebook, offering ways to make money is probably a route to encouraging people to use its platform rather than its competitorsâ€™, according to Dr Claire Wardle, executive director of First Draft, a US-based non-profit organisation fighting online misinformation, which contributed to the bureauâ€™s research. However, Facebook can also profit from the popularity of brands and individuals who spread misinformation. It takes a cut of 5% to 30% on its Stars currency, used by fans to tip creators who stream live video. Facebook also briefly took up to 30% of fees paid by new supporters from January last year, but reversed this in August. The bureau found two pages using Stars: An0maly and Sid Rothâ€™s Itâ€™s Supernatural, a religious site which has blamed the pandemic on abortion and has featured guests describing a dream in which God showed them the virus being created in a Chinese lab. Between them, the pages have reached more than 2.6 million people."" ... ""Yet despite removing the Highwire page, Facebook still allows Ican to solicit donations from its more than 44,000 followers on a page that has had at least two posts flagged by factcheckers. According to its page, Ican has raised almost Â£24,000 since February 2020. Facebook must approve organisations signing up to raise funds and vaccine misinformation is explicitly cited as a reason that fundraising may be removed from an organisation. Wardle, from First Draft, believes the money-making systems Facebook offers could encourage people to spread misinformation. â€œIt is human nature. We know one of the motivations is financial,â€ she said. â€œThey have started to believe these things, but when you are in that circle, you also realise there is a way to make money, then you realise that the more you get hits the more money you are making. Itâ€™s more than the dopamine hit â€“ itâ€™s dopamine plus dollars.â€""

If an individual no matter how committed to a cause works on **their own instead of as a team, they are each doomed to fail, and will all be defeated. The Crew has no magic wand to convince those of us who are in the majority, to get off their backsides, and do what my generation did in the 60s and 70s, in an effort to make a change. None of the members of the Crew believe that we are know it alls. One may consider us political skeptics, for we look at issues as if they are cubes, a three dimensional shape either solid or hollow, contained by six equal squares. For those readers who think the same way, the Crew leaves a portion of an article that appeared in the Atlantic Council dated 3/8/19. How To Kill A Disinformation Narrative: When trying to stop the spread of disinformation by malign foreign and domestic actors online, itâ€™s not enough to do the fact-checking. To really kill the power of the disinformation, we have to do the story telling. Too many politicians, and individuals are focused on disinformation as an information warfare problem, rather than narrative warfare. It is not access to better or new information that is making extremist propaganda more successful online, it's quite the contrary. We have the facts, but they have the stories. In many fake news postings, the information provided is often clearly distorted, but that is not the real point. Itâ€™s much easier to tell a story when you are not bound by the facts. The narratives pushed by the bots and trolls are the more dangerous weapons. They try to make you so angry and so scared that you stop thinking, and once you stop thinking, theyâ€™ve got you. Fact-checking the information, is simply not enough to counter the disinformation, as it does nothing to make the narrative less attractive. We should not be shy about publicly supporting what makes us strong, and stop being afraid that fb will send you to the dungeons. Success comes from controlling the narrative, getting out and facing the opposition, and working as whole, and not a slice. TUCKER F**KER COMPARES VAX TO NAZI EXPER. ON JEWS Fox News' Tucker Carlson was pummeled on social media Friday night after he compared vaccine requirements to protect Americans from COVID-19 to the barbaric experiments Nazis inflicted on Jews during World War II. Critics pointed out that Fox News has a vaccine reqirement so Carlson is likely not worried about contracting COVID himself, even while he encourages his viewers not to get them. They also pointed out that, late last year, Fox ""ghosted"" contributor Lara Logan after she compared White House health adviser Dr. Anthony Fauci to infamous Nazi doctor Josef Mengele for suggesting health guidelines to keep people safe amid the pandemic. The reason to take the COVID-19 vaccine is for the purpose of stopping the pandemic, and it requires using all the tools available. Vaccines work with your immune system so your body will be ready to fight the virus if you are exposed. Other steps, like wearing masks and social distancing, help reduce your chance of being exposed to the virus or spreading it to others. Together, COVID-19 vaccination, and following CDC's recommendations to protect yourself and others, will offer the best protection from COVID-19 Not only is the COVID-19 vaccine necessary to take, so is the Flu Shot. Getting a flu shot this year is particularly important because, like SARS-CoV-2, influenza is a respiratory virus, and we want to do everything we can to minimize having two respiratory outbreaks circulating simultaneously in our population. We THINKERS understand scientific facts and not a bunch of bulls#it. Get wise Crazy Motherfu@ckers, if for no other reason your children's lives depend on it. CRAZYMOTHERS DON'T LIKE TO BE CALLED ANTI-VAXXERS A group of people opposed to vaccinations has requested that media stop referring to them as ""anti-vax."" Instead, they would prefer to be called ""vaccine risk aware."" On Dec. 1, an anti-vaccine group called the Crazymothers raised its plea on Twitter and Instagram, asserting that the term anti-vaxxer is ""derogatory, inflammatory, and marginalizes both women and their experiences."" In response, many social media users chimed in with their own alternative labels for the group, including ""plague enthusiasts,"" ""polio fanciers,"" ""pro-disease"" and ""patient zero."" WHO ARE THE CRAZYMOTHERS??? Founded in 2018, the Crazymothers have just over 1,000 followers on Twitter and about 18,000 on Instagram. The group recently hosted an event in Washington to ""raise awareness to the current epidemic of chronic health conditions, injuries and death from vaccination."" Nearly 3,000 people attended, according to a Crazymothers Instagram post. The group sells merchandise and offers ""expert"" advice on its website. The T-shirts depict anti-vaccine moms as superheroes, and these ""experts"" raise concerns about specific ingredients found in vaccines and the methods by which vaccines are produced. The efforts of groups like this are a problem, because getting vaccinated doesn't just help the person stuck with the needle; it also protects infants and many people with weak immune systems who cannot be vaccinated at all. Vaccines ensure that fewer cases of the disease occur, and therefore, those without the means to defend themselves are more likely to stay safe and healthy. Anti-vaccine groups like the Crazymothers aim to make vaccination optional, which would place these vulnerable populations at risk, according to the APP. The Crazymothers may prefer the term ""vaccine risk aware,"" but in reality, unvaccinated children face far greater health risks than those who do get vaccinated. Meanwhile, the vulnerability to disease of unvaccinated kids places others at risk. The fewer people who get vaccinated, the more people will contract perfectly preventable diseases.

â€¢Timeâ€¢ the sedative was given
â€¢Timeâ€¢ the paralytic was given
â€¢Timeâ€¢ the patient was intubated
â€¢Timeâ€¢ their central line was placed
â€¢Timeâ€¢ their arterial line was placed
â€¢Timeâ€¢ their Vas Cath was placed
â€¢Timeâ€¢ CRRT initiated
â€¢Timeâ€¢ the patient was proned
â€¢Timeâ€¢ the ABG was drawn
â€¢Timeâ€¢ the family was notified
â€¢Timeâ€¢ the zoom meeting was set for
â€¢Timeâ€¢ the family said their goodbyes
â€¢Timeâ€¢ of death

That was someoneâ€™s mother, father, brother, sister, aunt, uncle, friend, spouse. 

That was their â€¢timeâ€¢ to go. And I feel confident in saying the virus made it too soon.

Iâ€™ve stood outside a patient room with clasped hands, giving a thumbs up to a patient through a window as they were being extubated. Moments before: 

â€œStay calm. The respiratory therapist is going to take this breathing tube out, okay? I need you to nod your head so I know you understand me. I know, donâ€™t try to talk. Youâ€™re doing great.â€

I've taught patients to call when they were ready to be intubated. Days of being on the BiPAP on 100% oxygen can only be effective for so long. They get tired. 

â€œI canâ€™t breathe.â€ 

â€œOkay, let me call the doctor and get everything ready.â€

â€œTell my kids I love them.â€ 

â€œTell them yourself we are calling them before this happens.â€ 

â€œPlease make sure I come off the ventilator.â€

â€œListen to me, you fight like heck, okay?â€

â€œHow am I supposed to fight when Iâ€™ll be asleep?â€

â€œYou just have to go into this knowing you want to fight. You will never be alone. We will fight this with you.â€

To: Nurses, Doctors, Nurse Practitioners, Respiratory Therapists, Pharmacists, CNAs, PCTs, Phlebotomists, Rad and CT techs, and anyone else I missed,

How many times do we go home holding on to any bit of hope that what we are doing is making a difference for these patients?

Weâ€™ll spend 14 hours with hypoxia and hypotension, go home, and come back only to find out the patient didnâ€™t make it.

All those times we felt like we werenâ€™t doing anything for these patients - Your chance is here.

If you have even the SLIGHTEST bit of opportunity to prevent getting this virus and giving it to others - Take it.

Do it for the patients you lost. For some, you were the last person they talked to. The last hand they held.

â€¢Timeâ€¢ 1118
Thatâ€™s the â€¢timeâ€¢ I received the Covid-19 vaccine today.

Jenifer, RN
Stormont Vail Health

column30: https://www.theatlantic.com/ideas/archive/2021/11/democrats-economy-election/620626/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=atlantic-daily-newsletter&utm_content=20211108&silverid=%25%25RECIPIENT_ID%25%25&utm_term=The%20Atlantic%20Daily To explain the Democratsâ€™ poor performance in state and local elections Tuesday, various commentators have made very specific claims: It was mostly about critical race theory, or mostly about Terry McAuliffeâ€™s flaws as a candidate for Virginia governor, or mostly about suburban white women voting like itâ€™s 2012 again. But none of these explanations is fully satisfying. The turn against Democrats wasnâ€™t limited to parents, or Virginia, or white women. Compared with the 2020 election, support for Democrats decayed across states, genders, ethnicities, and counties. Democrats lost because of something bigger than any demographic or issue. They lost a vibes war. Despite many positive economic trends, Americans are feeling rotten about the state of thingsâ€”and, understandably, theyâ€™re blaming the party in power. How are vibes any different from what weâ€™ve historically called economic fundamentals? Can President Joe Biden mount a comeback after losing the first decisive battle of the vibes war? And why do we always have to name stuff? The U.S. economy is booming. Kind of. Consumer demand is on a rocket ship upward, and Americans collectively are spending more money than ever on hard goods. The unemployment rate is lower today than it was for most of the 2010s. Having banked stimulus checks, unemployment insurance, student-loan-interest forgiveness, and other savings, Americans say that their finances are in excellent shape. Yet supply-chain snarls have made shopping harder, and incipient inflation has made what we can buy more expensive. Independents say theyâ€™re as despondent about the economy as they were during several months of the Great Recession. One measure of consumer confidenceâ€”buying conditions for household durablesâ€”has fallen to its lowest rate in about 40 years. Gas prices are salient, not only because people buy a lot of it, but also because theyâ€™re the only prices printed in 3,000-point type across the countryâ€”and theyâ€™ve gone way up under Biden. Meanwhile, the Delta variant obliterated promises of a hot vax summer, and the presidentâ€™s approval rating has tanked. These days itâ€™s good to be a savings account, or a nominal-gross-domestic-income graph. But bank accounts donâ€™t vote, and nominal-GDI graphs currently lack Senate representation. Consumers vote, and hiring managers vote, and overworked service-economy employees dealing with rude customers vote, and right now it stinks to be any of those people. An economist can tell you that, technically, things are looking up. But vibes eat technicalities for breakfast. The vibes are bad, and Democrats are suffering for it. For now! But we may have reached a vibe inflection point. The U.S. economy added 531,000 jobs in October. This is a good sign that Delta fears (like Delta cases) are waning, and the service economy is going back to normal. As pandemic savings are drawn down, more people will likely join the labor force, which will ease the worker shortage and help companies fill out their staff. The supply-chain meshugas is not going to end before Christmas, but nobody Iâ€™ve spoken with expects it to last a full year. Vaccine approval for kids should allay the fears of parents and help schools go back to normal, if schools and parents choose to do so. Young people are at much lower risk of severe illness than the elderly, but the mass vaccination of kids will help the U.S. avoid a repeat of whatâ€™s happening in the U.K., where cases are surging among unvaccinated children. New antiviral drugs from Pfizer and Merck will bring even more artillery into the fight against COVID in 2022. Meanwhile, Bidenâ€™s new de facto vaccination mandate is a quiet economic-stimulus policy that, despite the controversy around it, really will make life feel more normal for millions of Americans. This week, the White House announced that companies with 100 or more employees have to fully vaccinate their workforce or test unvaccinated employees for COVID on a weekly basis. The Department of Health and Human Services also requires health-care facilities participating in Medicare and Medicaid to make sure all their employees get shots. Despite threats of mass resignations in response to these mandates, the reality hasnâ€™t matched the headlines. In fact, vaccination requirements could result in more hirings, rather than more quits, as Americans fearful of infection feel more comfortable returning to fully vaccinated workplaces. Wagnerâ€™s music, as the saying goes, was better than it sounds. Todayâ€™s economy is better than it feels. If 2021 was the year of negative shocksâ€”Delta, labor shortages, supply-chain madness, and general shopping woesâ€”2022 could be the year of pleasant surprises, when the economyâ€™s statistical recovery (truncated)

column30: Forwarding a post by a previous friend who is an adamant anti vaxxer. There were 102,132 covid cases through Dec 2020. None of those had the vaccine. Jan to Sept has 74,295 new cases. MIKA: TRUMP CULT CONTINUES TO KILL MSNBC's Mika Brzezinski blasted Donald Trump and his ""evil allies"" who are casting doubts on the coronavirus vaccine as the highly contagious delta variant rages through conservative-leaning areas. The twice-impeached one-term president issued a statement blaming vaccine mistrust on President Joe Biden, but new infections among the unvaccinated are breaking out in areas that voted Trump. ""He's twisting it again,"" said the ""Morning Joe"" co-host. ""Let's just look at the facts, look at the hospital records, look at the people who are still dying. The U.S. surgeon general says 99 percent of those people who are dying don't have vaccines. column30: ""About 83 percent of Victorians aged over 16 have received at least one dose of vaccine and around 54 percent are fully vaccinated. The state remains committed to lifting lockdowns once 70 percent of the population has had both doses, a target expected to be hit later this month. I maintain that even Victoria is in too much of a rush to ease restrictions and open up, vaccines have only been readily available for a short time, myself and my wife have only just had our first AZ vaccination and will have our second in 12 weeks which will provide 82% protection for at a 6-week interval between doses it only provides 52% protection hence we will not be fully protected until after Christmas. Our local Clinic in regional Victoria was booked up for vaccination until September and many other regional areas were the same and they were also bowing to government pressure and had reduced the gap between Astra Zenica doses to 6 weeks which means that anyone who was vaccinated there will only have 52% protection, a toss of a coin as to whether you end up in Hospital or not. Note that where I live in regional Victoria there were no active COVID cases hence the reduction in the gap between doses which is recommended for hotspots is being carried out throughout Victoria. When Victoria opens up many others like us will have to hibernate in order to avoid becoming infected, some people will not be in a position to hibernate as they will be forced back to work this is when the worst of the COVID cases will take place. No one should be put in this position the federal government and the Victorian government should have provided more time for everyone to be vaccinated preferably to 90% not 70% or 80% and began opening up in the new year that few months would have saved lives. 70% vaccination is actually less than 50% because the under-12 population is almost 20%. ""Of the approximately 10,000 new cases recorded in the week to Tuesday, Acting Chief Health Officer Ben Cowie said 79 percent were unvaccinated."" This is proof that not enough people have been vaccinated, these unvaccinated are not all anti-vax, and given that a large percentage of people have had the 6-week gap between doses instead of the 12 weeks gap they are only 52% protected hence we can expect approx 50% of these people to become infected. Whilst some people are to blame initially for failing to abide by public health orders the government is responsible for enforcing the law as it does with all other laws. Now the people who wanted restrictions eased will get what they want and soon they will be allowed to go out and spread the virus anywhere they like I just wonder how many of them realise that in the rush to make this possible reducing the gap between doses of AZ has caused people to be much less protected than they may be aware of.

column30: The so-called â€œfreedom convoyâ€ â€“ which departed for Ottawa on 23 January â€“ was the brainchild of James Bauder, an admitted conspiracy theorist who has endorsed the QAnon movement and called Covid-19 â€œthe biggest political scam in historyâ€. Bauderâ€™s group, Canada Unity, contends that vaccine mandates and passports are illegal under Canadaâ€™s constitution, the Nuremberg Code and a host of other international conventions. Since they have arrived in Ottawa, the extreme elements of the protest have been visible: neo-Nazi and Confederate flags were seen flying, QAnon logos were emblazoned on trucks and signs and stickers were pasted to telephone poles around the occupied area bear Trudeauâ€™s face, reading: â€œWanted for crimes against humanity.â€ The occupiers now have the resources to stay for an extended period of time: they have raised more than C$6mthrough various crowdfunding platforms, in cash and Bitcoin, despite having been booted from GoFundMeâ€™s platform after raising over C$10m. The Ottawa occupation is proof that a few thousand determined protesters can overwhelm police and shut down major cities with enough vehicles and coordination. Solidarity convoys have already shut down the busy Coutts border crossing between Alberta and Montana, strained police resources in Toronto and Quebec City, and activists as far away as Helsinki, Canberra, London, and Brussels have taken not. On the convoy channels, protestors warn this is just the beginning.

column30: Jab or not to jab? Cautiousness changes according to perception of security. So although the Medicines and Healthcare products Regulatory Agency (MHRA) and the European Medicines Agency have approved the Oxford-AstraZeneca vaccine for adults there is doubt about how individuals can judge the science the government relies on. Germany, France and six other European nations have recommended OxAZ vax only for those under 65, Belgium and Italy for people under 55 and Switzerland for nobody at all. The problem is trials under-represented some groups; Pfizer trials had only 4% Asian representation and nobody over 89 took part. Regrettable that so few from highest risk groups participated if at all. Only 660 people over 65 where tested: 6% of participants. Two cases in this age range developed Covid-19: one who had vaccine the other had the dummy . Laboratory efficacy can not be deduced from this data alone. Regulatory agencies concluded there was insufficient evidence on older people, but absence of evidence and evidence of absence are not the same. The UK MHRA said: â€œThere is nothing to suggest lack of protection.â€ This is not based Pfizer trials, but on mix and match of data from other Covid-19 vaccines tests that do not show efficacy dropping with age. And remember, the mix and match approach uses different vaccine types like viral vector vaccines and mRNA types from different makers and different countries using different methods .. Those trials have not been repeated on groups who were missed in original studies. Researchers have use â€œbridging studiesâ€ to compare biological responses of different types of vaccine to fill in the missing data on protection to show the same efficacy trends can be assumed for different vaccines on different groups of people. When direct evidence of effects on older people comes from a US study opinions could change . In the meantime, protecting the most vulnerable is still vital as the gaps in vaccine laboratory test data do not make a case for their safety.

The Civilisationists in partnership with Professor Augusto Zimmermannâ€™s WALTA invite you to an important seminar on:

VAX PASSPORTS AND THE GREAT RESET

â€œYou will own nothing and you will be happy.â€ â€“ Klaus Schwab, World Economic Forum

When: Wednesday, 9 February 2022
Where: Oats Street, Carlisle WA 6101
At: 6.30 pm, for 7.00 pm start

The principle of legality known as the Rule of Law is â€œundoubtedly connected with individual freedom understood as freedom from interference on the part of everybody, including the authoritiesâ€ (Bruno Leoni, Freedom and the Law, 1972). However, vax passports turn this principle completely upside down. We have no freedoms until certain arbitrary â€œlawsâ€ allow us to do something.

The Speakers:

""THE ORIGINS OF THE GREAT RESET"" 

Dr Marion Hercock is an editor with the Western Australian Explorersâ€™ Diaries Project. A geographer, she has a PhD from the University of Western Australia, where she was, until recently, an adjunct research fellow. Her publications include works on public policy analysis and history.

""COMPULSORY PASSPORTS""

Dr Augusto Zimmermann is professor and head of Law at the Sheridan Institute of Higher Education, and also adjunct professor of law at the University of Notre Dame Australia (Sydney Campus). From 2012 to 2017 he served as Law Reform Commissioner in Western Australia, and is the author/co-author of numerous publications, including Fundamental Rights in the Age of Covid-19 (Connor Court Publishing, 2021).

Professor Zimmermann may have signed copies of his new book with Emeritus Professor GabriÃ«l A. Moens AM available (A$30, cash only):  Emergency Powers, Covid-19 Restrictions & Mandatory Vaccinations. A Rule of Law Perspective (Connor Court Publishing, 2022)

column30: $27M In Federal Funds Voted Down By Executive Council Several People Arrested After Being Accused Of Disrupting The Meeting CONCORD, NH - About 250 people gathered outside the NH Training and Police Standards facility in Concord Wednesday to express their concerns about the State of NH possibly accepting $27M in federal funds towards vaccine contracts. There was a heavy New Hampshire State Police presence outside the facility, and controlling access to the area where the meeting was being held. Only 173 People were allowed inside the facility due to fire code capacity. About 50 New Hampshire State Troopers were located around the outside of the facility and inside the facility. The public was in a cordoned-off area away from the press and government officials attending the meeting. The Governor spoke to the crowd at the beginning asking for people to remain peaceful and quiet so that the meeting could be held. After about 1.5 hours of the meeting, a small number of people in the crowd shouted out messages. A State Trooper spoke to the crowd saying that anyone who continued to disrupt the meeting would be arrested for Disorderly Conduct. Shortly after the warning the crowd stood and turned their back on the Executive Counselors. As people began to speak out Troopers took those people from the crowd bringing them to a secure area outside of the crowd. Loud messages were yelled out from those brought to the back area. About a dozen people were removed from the crowd, detained, and most faced arrests. NHSP has not released any details on how many people were arrested. Merrimack County officials said they received 8 people to be processed from the arrests at the Executive Council meeting. The Executive Council voted 4-1 to reject two controversial federal contracts to build out the stateâ€™s vaccine program and get more people vaccinated against COVID-19 through regional health networks. It makes New Hampshire the only state in the nation to reject such funding. The only vote in support of the contracts, which totaled $27 million, was Executive Councilors Cinde Warmington, D-Concord, who said by not supporting the money, the state would be turning its back on those who want to get the vaccine. Complete details on the meeting and other agenda items can be found at - http://indepthnh.org/2021/10/13/council-republicans-reject-27m-federal-vaccine-contracts-some-anti-vax-mandate-protesters-arrested/ Â©Jeffrey Hastings www.frameofmindphoto.com/news

column30: Fellow Ohioans, what do you think about DeWine's 5 million dollars drawing for those who have been vaccinated? I'm all for getting people vaccinated, but at the same time I feel like this money should be used to help schools, people who lost their jobs, etc. We are fortunate that our school district has the money to provide Chrome books to all students, but there's a lot of districts who can't. Believe me. I'd love to win the money, but I'm also worried people still won't get vaccinated and the money could have been better spent. Do you think it will work? I'm also afraid we will see spikes once the restrictions are lifted. Everyone I know is fully vaccinated(we have smart friends), dd is 12 yrs, so hoping to get an appointment for her's this week or next. I feel we are safe, but still worry for younger kids and those who can't get the vax because of medical conditions.

TRUMP 2021: ""February: 'Everybody, go get your shotâ€ Speaking at the Conservative Political Action Conference (CPAC), Trump said, â€œWe took care of a lot of people â€” including, I guess, on December 21st, we took care of Joe Biden, because he got his shot, he got his vaccine. â€¦ It shows you how unpainful that vaccine shot is.â€ Trump added: â€œSo everybody, go get your shot.â€ **MARCH: â€˜I WOULD RECOMMEND IT TOâ€™ MY VACCINE-SKEPTIC ALLIES** In a Fox News interview, Trump said, â€œI would recommend it to a lot of people that donâ€™t want to get it and a lot of those people voted for me, frankly.â€ He also repudiated claims that the vaccines arenâ€™t safe: â€œItâ€™s a great vaccine, itâ€™s a safe vaccine, and itâ€™s something that works.â€ **MID-APRIL: DEFENDED SAFETY OF JOHNSON & JOHNSON VACCINE** After the federal government paused its authorization of the Johnson & Johnson vaccine, in light of rare blood-clotting issue which vaccine skeptics seized upon, Trump excoriated the decision and pointed to the minimal adverse effects. â€œThe federal pause on the J&J shot makes no sense,â€ Trump said, adding: â€œJust six people out of the nearly 7 million whoâ€™ve gotten the Johnson & Johnson vaccine reported blood clots.â€ Trump even suggested that the move would feed the kind of anti-vaccine skepticism that was on the rise in his base. (Allies such as Tucker Carlson have often pointed to unverified reports in the Vaccine Adverse Event Reporting System, or VAERS.) â€œIndeed, this moronic move is a gift to the anti-vax movement,â€ Trump said. â€œThe science bureaucrats are fueling that deranged pseudoscience.â€ **LATE APRIL: â€˜THE VACCINE IS A GREAT THING, AND PEOPLE SHOULD TAKE ADVANTAGE OF ITâ€™** Trump told the New York Post: â€œIâ€™m all in favor of the vaccine. Itâ€™s one of the great achievements, a true miracle, and not only for the United States. Weâ€™re saving tens of millions of lives throughout the world. Weâ€™re saving entire countries.â€ Trump added that, â€œThe vaccine is a great thing, and people should take advantage of it,â€ while adding that it shouldnâ€™t be mandated. **JULY: â€˜I RECOMMEND YOU TAKE ITâ€™** At a rally in Arizona, Trump said, â€œI recommend you take it, but I also believe in your freedoms 100 percent.â€ **MID-AUGUST: â€˜ONCE YOU GET THE VACCINE, YOU GET BETTERâ€™** In the same interview in which Fox Business host Maria Bartiromo ultimately goaded Trump into initially questioning the boosters, Trump began by offering one of his most forceful pro-vaccine statements. â€œNow one thing: When you have the vaccine, people that do [get infected] â€” and itâ€™s a very small number relatively, but people that do get it â€” get better much quicker,â€ Trump said. â€œAnd itâ€™s very important to know. They donâ€™t get nearly as sick, and they get better. [Sen.] Lindsey Graham is an example. He said, if I didnâ€™t have this vaccine, I would have died.â€ â€œSo once you get the vaccine, you get better,â€ Trump added. **LATE AUGUST: â€˜TAKE THE VACCINES. â€¦ IT IS WORKING.â€™** At a rally in Alabama shortly after the Bartiromo interview, Trump again broadly promoted vaccines â€” even playing off those who booed him for it. â€œI recommend take the vaccines,â€ he said. â€œItâ€™s good. I did it. Take the vaccines.â€ As some in the crowd jeered, Trump took care to qualify his remarks by noting that this is about personal choice. But then he re-upped the message. â€œYou got â€” no, thatâ€™s okay. Thatâ€™s all right. You got your freedoms. But I happened to take the vaccine,â€ Trump said, before defusing the situation with a joke: â€œIf it doesnâ€™t work, youâ€™ll be the first to know.â€ He added: â€œBut it is working.â€ **SEPTEMBER: â€˜THE VACCINES DO WORK. â€¦ ITâ€™S TREMENDOUSLY SUCCESSFUL.'** â€œThe vaccines do work,â€ Trump said on a conservative talk-radio show. â€œAnd they are effective. So hereâ€™s my thing: I think I saved millions and millions of lives around the world.â€ He added: â€œAnd now countries are using our vaccines, and itâ€™s tremendous. Itâ€™s tremendously successful.â€ ""December: Donâ€™t let the libs win when you promote vaccine skepticism At an event with former Fox News host Bill Oâ€™Reilly in Dallas, Trump disclosed that he got a booster shot after all. He did so despite his August comments about a Big Pharma money-grab and despite having told the Wall Street (truncated)
