column30: This is an informative article from the ABC. It includes a good video that explains how the vaccine works, it also includes information about how the vaccine will prevent the spread of COVID-19. Whilst Anti-Vax misinformation propaganda is being spread about by a minority of ignorant people the majority of Australians are happy about the COVID-19 vaccination. The figures prove that it is the Right-Wingers who are most against vaccination and I have to say that every COVID Denying, Anti-Vax, Conspiracy theorist I have encountered has been a Right-Winger, some even Trump supporters! Australia will produce its own Oxford/AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine which is a great benefit although I would like the rollout to be much quicker, the federal govt state that it will take until October for most Australians to be vaccinated. In America: ""President Joe Biden said Tuesday that the U.S. expects to take delivery of enough coronavirus vaccines for all adult Americans by the end of May which will be five months quicker than Australia. Obviously, America is still in a pandemic crisis thanks to the Trump administration's inaction, and some Republican States continuing to lift restrictions/mask-wearing but America has 330 million people to vaccinate which is approx 12.5 times more than Australia's 26 million hence why should it take until October for Australians to be protected? Perhaps once the manufacture of the vaccine in Australia is ramped up we can step it up hopefully. All precautions must be kept up as even after vaccination the vaccine does not reach effectiveness for three to four weeks. People who are concerned about the Oxford/AstraZeneca vaccine need not be as it is just as effective as the Pfizer vaccine as shown in recent studies in the UK. See Dr. John Campbell's video where explains the studies and benefits of the vaccines. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=U3otWaBrvEc&t=1101s The only way out of this pandemic is vaccination.

column1: 1,000,000 Strong Against The Liberal National Party
column30: Copied not my words but struck a chord! I consider myself very fortunate to have a lot of friends on Facebook - a mixture of people I grew up with, friends from college, relatives, many people I used to teach, work colleagues, friends of my friends, and more recently a lot of friends who I discovered shared a similar outlook, socially and politically. And when I say friends, I do genuinely mean people I care about in some way - my politics have always been defined by caring about those I don't know, as well as those I do. It is quite heartbreaking at the moment to see so many of these friendships (both with myself and with others) put under strain by dangerously divisive messages coming from the far right in the US. Whatever crises or problems there are in the world, they each need to be considered on their own merit and dealt with through a rational response based upon evidence. We do not live in a binary world where everything falls on one side or other of some great divide - some of the issues are interlinked, and occasionally there is evidence of some kind of conspiracy or cover-up, but it cannot be the default position of any sane or rational person to think that everything is linked and that there is a Grand Conspiracy, with increasingly wild and far-fetched (and always unproven) claims and accusations. What is commonly referred to as the 'rabbit hole' is a collection of struck-off doctors, media personalities, politicians and broadcasters pulling together a myriad of YouTube videos, memes and 'he said, she said' testimonies, each of which can be disproved with 5 minutes of searching on the internet. These 'conspiracy theories' actually damage and weaken the real conspiracies taking place in society, such as the drive to increase wealth inequality that sees rocketing homelessness at the same time as increasing numbers of billionaires, the poisoning of populations through the use of chemicals in our food supply, the abandonment of the environment to market forces, the secret trade deals that weaken our rights as consumers and workers, the illegal wars and genocides that kill our populations as well as the planet. What the right has cleverly done, through groups like QAnon, is weave their easily disprovable 'conspiracy theories' together into a package that makes it easy to entrap people who would not necessarily know what else is being suggested, who then subscribe to dangerous views that run counter to what they might previously have stood for. Good examples of this were the marches that took place last weekend, purportedly about 'saving the children' and 'freedom of speech' - two concepts that would understandably draw in a lot of passing support - that were heavily attended by fascists and the far right, people who would never normally appear at a march to support students, the NHS, XR, or the People's Assembly. Online, people are connected to posts and memes spreading all kinds of disinformation that taps into the understandable fear and mistrust people are feeling about the direction society is travelling in. Particularly heartbreaking for me is to see friends who previously were most concerned about environmental issues, Palestine, racism, homophobia and other real issues, being diverted into something that has the opposite voice. And the nexus of all this is the real battle between good and evil that is taking place in Trump's America right now. And sadly, there are people who should know better who are being drawn into supporting that wannabe dictator because their conspiracy theories have told them that he is on the side of whichever truth they have been lulled into believing. The important things that need to be remembered, and repeated to those who have disappeared down that 'rabbit hole', is that support for Trump and these various conspiracy theories (5G, Pizzagate, Plandemic, Bill Gates, anti-vax, anti-mask etc etc) means that in the binary world they've created, you also support by association all of the following: - homophobia - racism - transphobia - Islamaphobia - mysogyny - disablism - white supremacy - the undermining of democratically elected foreign governments - uncontrolled militarism - genocide of Palestinians and Yemenis - destruction of the Middle East, particularly Syria - the creation of hundreds of thousands of refugees - poverty - homelessness - inequality - anti-environmentalism - anti-science and many, many more reactionary positions. All of these can be proven by a quick internet search of what has been said by Trump and his fellow 'conspiracy theorists' and the actions they have taken. And yet many people caught in this net of conspiracy will have LGBTQ family members, or have friends of different races and religions, and be the people most affected by the real conspiracies of this world. In this febrile and unsettled times, people are understandably groping for certainty - but please spend a moment to look into which side you are really on. There is no (truncated)

column30: ECONOMY CONCERNED REPUBLICANS: HISTORY DEFIES MANCHINâ€™S TALKING POINTS. APRIL 15, 2018: â€œThe Democrats Are the Party of Fiscal Responsibilityâ€ New York Times April 15, 2018 â€œBy now, nobody should be surprised when the Republican Party violates its claims of fiscal rectitude. Increasing the deficit â€” through big tax cuts, mostly for the rich â€” has been the defining feature of the partyâ€™s economic policy for decades. When Paul Ryan and other Republicans call themselves fiscal conservatives, theyâ€™re basically doing a version of the old Marx Brothers bit: â€œWho ya gonna believe, me or your own eyes?â€ Ever so slowly, conventional wisdom has started to recognize this reality. After Ryanâ€™s retirement announcement last week, only a few headlines called him a deficit hawk. People are catching on to the con. But there is still a major way that the conventional wisdom is wrong: It doesnâ€™t give the Democratic Party enough credit for its actual fiscal conservatism.â€ BLATANTLY OBVIOUS ADMINISTRATIVE SABOTAGE BY MANCHIN AND SINEMA: â€œCentrist Senator Joe Manchin voiced criticism of Democratsâ€™ proposed tax on billionaires to help pay for their reconciliation package. â€œI donâ€™t like it. It doesnâ€™t make sense to me,â€ Manchin said. â€œI just canâ€™t do it.â€ STOP SPEWING REPUBLICAN BULLSHIT. FOR THE PAST EIGHTY YEARS, DEMOCRAT PRESIDENTS HAVE OUTPERFORMED REPUBLICANS BY NEARLY TWICE THE G.N.P. AVERAGE. GUESS WHAT, BIDEN IS A DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENT! â€œWhy Are Republican Presidents So Bad for the Economy? G.D.P., jobs and other indicators have all risen faster under Democrats for nearly the pastâ€ New York Times February 2, 2021 â€œSince 1933, the economy has grown at an annual average rate of 4.6 percent under Democratic presidents and 2.4 percent under Republicans, according to a Times analysis. In more concrete terms: The average income of Americans would be more than double its current level if the economy had somehow grown at the Democratic rate for all of the past nine decades. If anything, that period (which is based on data availability) is too kind to Republicans, because it excludes the portion of the Great Depression that happened on Herbert Hooverâ€™s watch.â€ THEY KNOW THEY ARE HANDING CONGRESS BACK TO A BATCH OF REPUBLICANS THAT ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR THE TRIPLE-TRUMP CATASTROPHE: 1. THEY ALSO KNOW THE REPUBLICAN AND RIGHT-WING ANTI-VAX DISINFORMATION EFFORT â€œOPERATION NEGLIGENT HOMICIDEâ€ IS WHAT CAUSED THE SURGE THAT IS RESPONSIBLE FOR OVER NINETY THOUSAND PREVENTABLE FATALITIES SINCE THEIR OPERATION BEGAN. column34: This is a re-share of a post
column35:
COVID-19 still persists in the USA because we don't have Medicare for All or a social safety net to cover people forced out of work. 

We don't have M4A or coverage for people forced out of work because people keep voting for politicians that tell them ""we can't afford it""- and they're stupid enough to believe them. 

No one seems to know that everyone in Israel has national, single-payer healthcare (and free college, BTW) courtesy of the same American taxpayers that vote for people who refuse to give it to U.S. citizens. 

Meanwhile, the government has handed trillions to Wall Street and transnational corporations under the guise of ""bailouts,"" and those companies turn around and fire their workers anyway- and the banks foreclose on homes, evict renters, and seize assets from people who can't pay. 

Billions of that ""bailout money"" have gone to pay bonuses to corporate executives and inflate stock prices to enrich big money investors. 

The country's billionaires have been enriched to the tune of $300B in the past five months as 50% of the country is out of work and without healthcare.

The numbers of COVID-19 positive people keeps escalating here because people without healthcare or money to pay basic expenses can't afford to get tested, can't afford to pay for treatment if tested positive, and can't afford to be forced out of work with no compensation. 

The government could very well have solved this, but in six months, five COVID-19 bills through Congress, and being on taxpayer-funded paid vacation for a total of three months since March, they have instead chosen to enrich oligarchs and plutocrats.

As the rest of the world's COVID-19 problem declines and life goes back to normal, it is also notable that NO OTHER COUNTRY saw millions of workers fired from their jobs, left destitute, or losing their healthcare. 

This is because corporations in those countries were not permitted by governments to rob trillions of taxpayer money for their own pockets while screwing workers. 

It is also because no other country has a stupid for-profit healthcare system, controlled by pointless, predatory middlemen called ""insurance companies"" and where said insurance is dependent on some corporation being willing to give it to you. 

The USA is now in the worst economic Depression in history, and millions of Americans haven't seem to have woken up to the fact- even though it's a goddamn election year with two equally horrible candidates on the table, and a Democratic party that rigged its own primary for the 2nd time against the ONE GUY fighting for the very things that would have solved this problem.

Meanwhile, authoritarian controls over society like forced mask-wearing and other measures to distance us from each other, cause us to be anonymous from one another, and prevent us from unifying against the system have rapidly become the new normal as people incapable of thinking beyond their COVID-19 fears don't bother questioning the agenda behind it all. 

The next thing coming is a mandatory vaccine orchestrated, created, and funded by Bill Gates. Anyone that knows the history of the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation's ""vaccine philanthropy"" on the African continent knows they'd rather leave the country on a raft before allowing the government to force them into it. 

Wherever you stand on the COVID-19 vax argument, or even social distancing and masks, none of this is coming to an end in the near future. In fact, this is life in the USA now for the next year, possibly two to three years. 

All because a bunch of idiot voters refuse to hold their goddamn government accountable and force it to represent the people. 

If that doesn't enrage the living shit out of you, you either have zero integrity, zero concern for your fellow citizens, or are just willfully ignorant.
